type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@graph":[{"@type":"NewsArticle","@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment#article","isPartOf":{"@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment"},"author":{"name":"Ameya Paleja","@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/#/schema/person/228699245718b47295471284aabc21c5"},"headline":"An HIV-Positive Patient Has Cleared Her Body From the Virus Without Treatment","datePublished":"2021-11-16T08:52:48+00:00","dateModified":"2021-11-16T08:52:48+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":{"@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment"},"wordCount":487,"commentCount":0,"publisher":{"@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/#organization"},"keywords":["Biology"],"articleSection":["Health"],"inLanguage":"en-US","potentialAction":[{"@type":"CommentAction","name":"Comment","target":["https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment#respond"]}],"copyrightYear":"2021","copyrightHolder":{"@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/#organization"},"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":false,"caption":false},"publishingPrinciples":"https://interestingengineering.com/policies/editorial-policy","articleBody":"In an extremely rare event, a woman, who prefers to stay anonymous, from the Esperanza province in Argentina has managed to clear the HIV virus from her body. First diagnosed in 2013, the woman recently underwent multiple viral load tests but showed no detectable signs of the virus or symptoms of the disease, Science Alert reported. An HIV infection targets the immune system in the body, and if left untreated, it can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). Since the latter has no cure, anti-virals are used to treat the infection during its early stages and slow down the progression of the disease. Researchers aiming to cure HIV try to bring the viral load to levels where the virus does not replicate even without treatment. This is called a functional cure. The other way, although difficult to achieve, is the complete elimination of the virus or its replicating components in the body. Called sterilizing cure, is what the Argentine patient has achieved. There have been other notable cases of such sterilizing cures earlier as well. Known around the world as &#8216;Berlin patient&#8217; and &#8216;London Patient&#8217;, these HIV-positive individuals received stem cell transplants that helped their bodies fight the virus and eliminate them completely. The Esperanza patient, though, did not receive any stem cell transplants and her cure appears to have come from anti-virals alone. The patient was first diagnosed with HIV, way back in 2013. It was only when she was pregnant between 2019-2020 that she took anti-viral drugs. After delivering a healthy and HIV-negative baby, the woman stopped her therapy and appeared to have eliminated the virus completely from her body. Such individuals where HIV is not detected without any specific treatment are referred to as &#8216;elite controllers&#8217; or &#8216;natural suppressors,&#8217; Science Alert reported. While the virus might not be detectable by commercially available Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests, specific laboratory tests used for research purposes usually find traces of the virus or its components in a patient&#8217;s blood sample. In the case of &#8216;Esperanza patient&#8217;, even detection was not possible, the researchers told Science Alert.The patient managed to completely eliminate the virus from her body during the infection&#8217;s natural course. Last year, we reported a Brazilian man who was cured of HIV after intensive medication. But the Argentine woman&#8217;s accomplishment is at a different level altogether. This has only been reported once before, in a Californian patient, Loreen Willenberg, Science Alert reported. The scientific process, however, does not allow this to be considered as proof that HIV can be cured naturally. This finding is empirical or based on observation and does not allow for it to be tested and verified. So, while the Argentine woman has surprised the scientific community, she still isn&#8217;t &#8216;living proof&#8217; that HIV can be cured naturally. The finding was published in Annals of Internal Medicine."},{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment","url":"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment","name":"An HIV-Positive Patient Has Cleared Her Body From the Virus Without md:t-mb-[16px] articleThumbnail_article_thumbnail__pQ08x"><img alt="An HIV-Positive Patient Has Cleared Her Body From the Virus Without Treatment" loading="lazy" width="584" height="421" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="articleThumbnail_article_thumbnail__image__HYfDF" style="color:transparent" srcset="/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.interestingengineering.com%2Fimg%2Fiea%2F94w5erJpwo%2Fan-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment.jpg&amp;w=640&amp;q=75 1x, /_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.interestingengineering.com%2Fimg%2Fiea%2F94w5erJpwo%2Fan-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment.jpg&amp;w=1200&amp;q=75 2x" src="/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.interestingengineering.com%2Fimg%2Fiea%2F94w5erJpwo%2Fan-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment.jpg&amp;w=1200&amp;q=75"><div class="t-flex t-justify-between article-thumbnail--info t-mt-2"><p class="article-thumbnail--description body-xsmall-medium t-text-text-third">An Argentinian woman was cured of HIV naturally.</p><p class="article-thumbnail--reference body-xsmall-medium t-text-text-third"><a title="Eight years after her diagnosis, she is cured of HIV, naturally" href="https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/hiv-blood-in-a-test-tube-gm547410420-98898913" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Thomas Faull/iStock</a></p></div></div><div class="t-max-w-full t-w-main-layout t-flex t-flex-col t-justify-center  t-self-center t-tab-px-0 t-px-0 md:t-px-0 socialShare_relative__B0YIR"><div class="body-content true   articleBody_firstLetter__fWMYV body-medium-medium  t-text-text-secondary"><div><p>In an extremely rare event, a woman, who prefers to stay anonymous, from the Esperanza province in Argentina has managed to clear the HIV virus from her body. First diagnosed in 2013, the woman recently underwent multiple viral load tests but showed no detectable signs of the virus or symptoms of the disease, <a href="https://www.sciencealert.com/extremely-rare-case-suggests-woman-was-naturally-cured-of-the-hiv-virus" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">Science Alert reported</a>.&nbsp;</p>
<p>An HIV infection targets the immune system in the body, and if left untreated, it can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). Since the latter has no cure, anti-virals are used to treat the infection during its early stages and slow down the progression of the disease. Researchers aiming to cure HIV try to bring the viral load to levels where the virus does not replicate even without treatment. This is called a <a href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28529952/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">functional cure</a>. The other way, although difficult to achieve, is the complete elimination of the virus or its replicating components in the body. Called sterilizing cure, is what the Argentine patient has achieved.&nbsp;</p></div></div><div class="body-content true    body-medium-medium  t-text-text-secondary"><div>
<p>There have been other notable cases of such sterilizing cures earlier as well. Known around the world as ‘Berlin patient’ and ‘<a href="https://interestingengineering.com/london-patient-is-second-person-ever-to-be-cured-of-hiv" rel="dofollow">London Patient’</a>, these HIV-positive individuals received stem cell transplants that helped their bodies fight the virus and eliminate them completely. The Esperanza patient, though, did not receive any stem cell transplants and her cure appears to have come from anti-virals alone.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The patient was first diagnosed with HIV, way back in 2013. It was only when she was pregnant between 2019-2020 that she took anti-viral drugs. After delivering a healthy and HIV-negative baby, the woman stopped her therapy and appeared to have eliminated the virus completely from her body.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Such individuals where HIV is not detected without any specific treatment are referred to as ‘elite controllers’ or ‘natural suppressors,’ Science Alert reported. While the virus might not be detectable by commercially available Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests, specific laboratory tests used for research purposes usually find traces of the virus or its components in a patient’s blood sample. In the case of ‘Esperanza patient’, even detection was not possible, the researchers told Science Alert.</p></div></div><div class="recommendedArticle_recommended_article__ENN1_"><div data-orientation="horizontal" role="none" class="t-shrink-0 t-bg-stroke-primary t-h-[1px] t-w-full max-md:t-hidden md:t-mb-[16px]"></div><h4 class="recommended-article--title overline-medium-bold color-gray-500">RECOMMENDED ARTICLES</h4><div class="OUTBRAIN" data-widget-id="GS_11"></div><div data-orientation="horizontal" role="none" class="t-shrink-0 t-bg-stroke-primary t-h-[1px] t-w-full max-md:t-hidden md:t-mb-[16px]"></div></div><div class="body-content true    body-medium-medium  t-text-text-secondary"><div>
<p>The patient managed to completely eliminate the virus from her body during the&nbsp;infection’s natural course. Last year, we reported a Brazilian man who was <a href="https://interestingengineering.com/brazilian-man-could-be-first-ever-cured-of-hiv-with-drugs-alone" rel="dofollow">cured of HIV after intensive</a> medication. But the Argentine woman’s accomplishment is at a different level altogether. This has only been reported once before, in a Californian patient, Loreen Willenberg, Science Alert reported.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The scientific process, however, does not allow this to be considered as proof that HIV can be cured naturally. This finding is empirical or based on observation and does not allow for it to be tested and verified. So, while the Argentine woman has surprised the scientific community, she still isn’t ‘living proof’ that HIV can be cured naturally.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The finding was published in <a href="https://www.acpjournals.org/doi/10.7326/L21-0297" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><em>Annals of Internal Medicine</em></a>.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="t-max-w-full t-w-main-layout t-flex t-flex-col t-justify-center  t-self-center t-tab-px-0 t-px-0 md:t-px-0 socialShare_relative__B0YIR"><div class=""><div class="CommentSection_commentsblock__cerVm" id="commentsBlock"><div class="CommentSection_title__aI0LW t-inline-flex t-justify-center t-items-center t-gap-1 comments-toggle"><span><svg 1.68166 2.18716C1.84144 1.88137 2.09641 1.63275 2.41002 1.47694C2.76654 1.2998 3.23325 1.2998 4.16667 1.2998H8.83333C9.76675 1.2998 10.2335 1.2998 10.59 1.47694C10.9036 1.63275 11.1586 1.88137 11.3183 9.42562H5.21319C4.8665 9.42562 4.69315 9.42562 4.52734 9.4588C4.38024 9.48824 4.23789 9.53693 4.10416 9.60355C3.95343 9.67864 3.81807 9.78423 3.54734 9.99542L2.22209 11.0292C1.99093 11.2095 1.87535 stroke-linejoin="round"></path></svg></span><span>0</span><span>COMMENT</span><span><svg class="CommentSection_commentsblock__icon__8tm_8 svg-icon" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16px" 699-f02178258bb80146.js\",\"6090\",\"static/chunks/6090-ab76ea34a53a4762.js\",\"7682\",\"static/chunks/7682-34723998be322c0f.js\",\"9615\",\"static/chunks/9615-a83f9cf8539efe85.js\",\"9212\",\"static/chunks/9212-416114feab18f184.js\",\"3795\",\"static/chunks/3795-368927cb76a1d946.js\",\"8021\",\"static/chunks/8021-a9667b116e8e2ab2.js\",\"7595\",\"static/chunks/7595-17a2657006bf8213.js\",\"7931\",\"static/chunks/7931-6485169596b8acf5.js\",\"9330\",\"static/chunks/9330-23963a8008835e5d.js\",\"7192\",\"static/chunks/app/%5BcategoryId%5D/%5BarticleId%5D/page-8fc38dea195eb176.js\"],\"\"]\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"1c:T1ed7,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"{\"@context\":\"https://schema.org\",\"@graph\":[{\"@type\":\"NewsArticle\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment#article\",\"isPartOf\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment\"},\"author\":{\"name\":\"Ameya Paleja\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#/schema/person/228699245718b47295471284aabc21c5\"},\"headline\":\"An HIV-Positive Patient Has Cleared Her Body From the Virus Without Treatment\",\"datePublished\":\"2021-11-16T08:52:48+00:00\",\"dateModified\":\"2021-11-16T08:52:48+00:00\",\"mainEntityOfPage\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment\"},\"wordCount\":487,\"commentCount\":0,\"publisher\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#organization\"},\"keywords\":[\"Biology\"],\"articleSection\":[\"Health\"],\"inLanguage\":\"en-US\",\"potentialAction\":[{\"@type\":\"CommentAction\",\"name\":\"Comment\",\"target\":[\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment#respond\"]}],\"copyrightYear\":\"2021\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#organization\"},\"image\":{\"@type\":\"ImageObject\",\"url\":false,\"caption\":false},\"publishingPrinciples\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/policies/editorial-policy\",\"articleBody\":\"In an extremely rare event, a woman, who prefers to stay anonymous, from the Esperanza province in Argentina has managed to clear the HIV virus from her body. First diagnosed in 2013, the woman recently underwent multiple viral load tests but showed no detectable signs of the virus or symptoms of the disease, Science Alert reported. An HIV infection targets the immune system in the body, and if left untreated, it can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). Since the latter has no cure, anti-virals are used to treat the infection during its early stages and slow down the progression of the disease. Researchers aiming to cure HIV try to bring the viral load to levels where the virus does not replicate even without treatment. This is called a functional cure. The other way, although difficult to achieve, is the complete elimination of the virus or its replicating components in the body. Called sterilizing cure, is what the Argentine patient has achieved. There have been other notable cases of such sterilizing cures earlier as well. Known around the world as \u0026#8216;Berlin patient\u0026#8217; and \u0026#8216;London Patient\u0026#8217;, these HIV-positive individuals received stem cell transplants that helped their bodies fight the virus and eliminate them completely. The Esperanza patient, though, did not receive any stem cell transplants and her cure appears to have come from anti-virals alone. The patient was first diagnosed with HIV, way back in 2013. It was only when she was pregnant between 2019-2020 that she took anti-viral drugs. After delivering a healthy and HIV-negative baby, the woman stopped her therapy and appeared to have eliminated the virus completely from her body. Such individuals where HIV is not detected without any specific treatment are referred to as \u0026#8216;elite controllers\u0026#8217; or \u0026#8216;natural suppressors,\u0026#8217; Science Alert reported. While the virus might not be detectable by commercially available Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests, specific laboratory tests used for research purposes usually find traces of the virus or its components in a patient\u0026#8217;s blood sample. In the case of \u0026#8216;Esperanza patient\u0026#8217;, even detection was not possible, the researchers told Science Alert.The patient managed to completely eliminate the virus from her body during the infection\u0026#8217;s natural course. Last year, we reported a Brazilian man who was cured of HIV after intensive medication. But the Argentine woman\u0026#8217;s accomplishment is at a different level altogether. This has only been reported once before, in a Californian patient, Loreen Willenberg, Science Alert reported. The scientific process, however, does not allow this to be considered as proof that HIV can be cured naturally. This finding is empirical or based on observation and does not allow for it to be tested and verified. So, while the Argentine woman has surprised the scientific community, she still isn\u0026#8217;t \u0026#8216;living proof\u0026#8217; that HIV can be cured naturally. The finding was published in Annals of Internal Medicine.\"},{\"@type\":\"WebPage\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment\",\"url\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/an-hiv-positive-patient-has-cleared-her-body-from-the-virus-without-treatment\",\"name\":\"An anonymous, from the Esperanza province in Argentina has managed to clear the HIV virus from her body. First diagnosed in 2013, the woman recently underwent multiple viral load tests but showed no detectable signs of the virus or symptoms of the disease, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencealert.com/extremely-rare-case-suggests-woman-was-naturally-cured-of-the-hiv-virus\"   rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eScience Alert reported\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAn HIV infection targets the immune system in the body, and if left untreated, it can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). Since the latter has no cure, anti-virals are used to treat the infection during its early stages and slow down the progression of the disease. Researchers aiming to cure HIV try to bring the viral load to levels where the virus does not replicate even without treatment. This is called a \u003ca href=\"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28529952/\"   rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efunctional cure\u003c/a\u003e. The other way, although difficult to achieve, is the complete elimination of the virus or its replicating components in the body. Called sterilizing cure, is what the Argentine patient has achieved. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThere have been other notable cases of such sterilizing cures earlier as well. Known around the world as \u0026#8216;Berlin patient\u0026#8217; and \u0026#8216;\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/london-patient-is-second-person-ever-to-be-cured-of-hiv\"   rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eLondon Patient\u0026#8217;\u003c/a\u003e, these HIV-positive individuals received stem cell transplants that helped their bodies fight the virus and eliminate them completely. The Esperanza patient, though, did not receive any stem cell transplants and her cure appears to have come from anti-virals alone. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe patient was first diagnosed with HIV, way back in 2013. It was only when she was pregnant between 2019-2020 that she took anti-viral drugs. After delivering a healthy and HIV-negative baby, the woman stopped her therapy and appeared to have eliminated the virus completely from her body. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSuch individuals where HIV is not detected without any specific treatment are referred to as \u0026#8216;elite controllers\u0026#8217; or \u0026#8216;natural suppressors,\u0026#8217; Science Alert reported. While the virus might not be detectable by commercially available Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests, specific laboratory tests used for research purposes usually find traces of the virus or its components in a patient\u0026#8217;s blood sample. In the case of \u0026#8216;Esperanza patient\u0026#8217;, even detection was not possible, the researchers told Science Alert.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe patient managed to completely eliminate the virus from her body during the infection\u0026#8217;s natural course. Last year, we reported a Brazilian man who was \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/brazilian-man-could-be-first-ever-cured-of-hiv-with-drugs-alone\"   rel=\"dofollow\"\u003ecured of HIV after intensive\u003c/a\u003e medication. But the Argentine woman\u0026#8217;s accomplishment is at a different level altogether. This has only been reported once before, in a Californian patient, Loreen Willenberg, Science Alert reported. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe scientific process, however, does not allow this to be considered as proof that HIV can be cured naturally. This finding is empirical or based on observation and does not allow for it to be tested and verified. So, while the Argentine woman has surprised the scientific community, she still isn\u0026#8217;t \u0026#8216;living proof\u0026#8217; that HIV can be cured naturally. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe finding was published in \u003ca href=\"https://www.acpjournals.org/doi/10.7326/L21-0297\"   rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAnnals of Internal Medicine\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"20:T4e5,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cp\u003eIn an extremely rare event, a woman, who prefers to stay anonymous, from the Esperanza province in Argentina has managed to clear the HIV virus from her body. First diagnosed in 2013, the woman recently underwent multiple viral load tests but showed no detectable signs of the virus or symptoms of the disease, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencealert.com/extremely-rare-case-suggests-woman-was-naturally-cured-of-the-hiv-virus\"   rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eScience Alert reported\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAn HIV infection targets the immune system in the body, and if left untreated, it can lead to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). Since the latter has no cure, anti-virals are used to treat the infection during its early stages and slow down the progression of the disease. Researchers aiming to cure HIV try to bring the viral load to levels where the virus does not replicate even without treatment. This is called a \u003ca href=\"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28529952/\"   rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efunctional cure\u003c/a\u003e. The other way, although difficult to achieve, is the complete elimination of the virus or its replicating components in the body. Called sterilizing cure, is what the Argentine patient has achieved. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"21:T58c,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eThere have been other notable cases of such sterilizing cures earlier as well. Known around the world as \u0026#8216;Berlin patient\u0026#8217; and \u0026#8216;\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/london-patient-is-second-person-ever-to-be-cured-of-hiv\"   rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eLondon Patient\u0026#8217;\u003c/a\u003e, these HIV-positive individuals received stem cell transplants that helped their bodies fight the virus and eliminate them completely. The Esperanza patient, though, did not receive any stem cell transplants and her cure appears to have come from anti-virals alone. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe patient was first diagnosed with HIV, way back in 2013. It was only when she was pregnant between 2019-2020 that she took anti-viral drugs. After delivering a healthy and HIV-negative baby, the woman stopped her therapy and appeared to have eliminated the virus completely from her body. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSuch individuals where HIV is not detected without any specific treatment are referred to as \u0026#8216;elite controllers\u0026#8217; or \u0026#8216;natural suppressors,\u0026#8217; Science Alert reported. While the virus might not be detectable by commercially available Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests, specific laboratory tests used for research purposes usually find traces of the virus or its components in a patient\u0026#8217;s blood sample. In the case of \u0026#8216;Esperanza patient\u0026#8217;, even detection was not possible, the researchers told Science Alert.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"22:T444,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eThe patient managed to completely eliminate the virus from her body during the infection\u0026#8217;s natural course. Last year, we reported a Brazilian man who was \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/brazilian-man-could-be-first-ever-cured-of-hiv-with-drugs-alone\"   rel=\"dofollow\"\u003ecured of HIV after intensive\u003c/a\u003e medication. But the Argentine woman\u0026#8217;s accomplishment is at a different level altogether. This has only been reported once before, in a Californian patient, Loreen Willenberg, Science Alert reported. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe scientific process, however, does not allow this to be considered as proof that HIV can be cured naturally. This finding is empirical or based on observation and does not allow for it to be tested and verified. So, while the Argentine woman has surprised the scientific community, she still isn\u0026#8217;t \u0026#8216;living proof\u0026#8217; that HIV can be cured naturally. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe finding was published in \u003ca href=\"https://www.acpjournals.org/doi/10.7326/L21-0297\"   rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAnnals of Internal Medicine\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"23:T1f2e,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003c!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"24:T19ac,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eArchaeologists discovered that Dmanisis Gora, a stunning 3,000-year-old “mega fortress” in the Caucasus, was so large that they had to take to the skies to capture its “exceptional size.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCranfield University academic Erb-Satullo and Dimitri Jachvliani, his co-director from the Georgian National Museum, began investigating the Dmanisis Gora settlement in 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, only recently did the full scope of the well-preserved site reveal itself to researchers when the autumn season stripped the landscape bare of its fauna. In the summer, the grass had reached their knees, obstructing the view.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOutside the inner fortress, they detected additional fortification walls and other stone structures, according to a recent press release. Dmanisis Gora appeared even more gargantuan than they had originally thought. They needed to send in the drones as it ended up extending hundreds of acres.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the premier example in the region due to its sheer size, the study at the Dmanisis Gora will provide unmatched insights into the prehistory of the South Caucasus and global patterns of ancient “mega-structures” worldwide.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135475\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eThe Dmanisis Gora site at dusk, showing the location at the convergence of two gorges / \u003ca href=\"https://www.cranfield.ac.uk/press/news-2025/mega-fortress-in-the-southern-caucasus\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eCranfield University\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-taking-to-the-skies-to-capture-over-a-hundred-acres\"\u003eTaking to the skies to capture over a hundred acres\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSituated at the convergence of two gorges, the excavations at Dmanisis Gora began on a fortified promontory between these recesses. As per a recent press release, other archaeological remains surfaced when the season permitted outside this inner fortress, which required the use of drone technology. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“That was what sparked the idea of using a drone to assess the site from the air,” Dr Erb-Satullo explained in a press release.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe team used a DJI Phantom 4 RTK drone, which provided “relative positional accuracy of under 2cm as well as extremely high-resolution aerial imagery.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“The drone took nearly 11,000 pictures, which were knitted together using advanced software to produce high-resolution digital elevation models and orthophotos – composite pictures that show every point as if you were looking straight down,” Dr Erb-Satullo continued.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe site was 40 times larger than they originally surveyed, effectively spanning 148 -198 acres. “The use of drones has allowed us to understand the significance of the site and document it in a way that simply wouldn’t have been possible on the ground,\u0026#8221; Dr Erb-Satullo said. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFurthermore, they investigated how the landscape had evolved using declassified spy satellite imagery, a resource that archaeologists continue to benefit from in recent years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFifty-year-old photographs taken in the Cold War area, which have been accessible since 2013, gave researchers further information concerning any damage that the mega-ancient and significant site incurred over the years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-site-singular-in-prominence-in-the-south-caucasus\"\u003eA site singular in prominence in the South Caucasus\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAll in all, its size exceeds that of the other fortresses nearby with an added feature of a double rather than single fortification around the inner fortress, researchers explained in a recent study.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt suggests that the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/britains-butchered-bones-cannibalism-study\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eBronze Age site\u003c/a\u003e might have been singular in prominence in the South Caucasus as fortress settlements began to pop up between 1500 and 500 BCE, as per the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cranfield.ac.uk/press/news-2025/mega-fortress-in-the-southern-caucasus\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epress release\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThey hypothesize that residents resided permanently in the inner fortress. The outer layer might reflect seasonal inhabitants or an attempt to settle a large population, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/antiquity/article/megafortresses-in-the-south-caucasus-new-data-from-southern-georgia/7752B2551034811556C96E75E909D730#article\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ethe study continued\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers have continued excavating the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/culture/mexico-1375-year-old-pyramid-found\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eancient city\u003c/a\u003e. \u0026#8220;Uncovering tens of thousands of pottery shards, animal bones, and other artifacts,\u0026#8221; they are learning more about the society that built it. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDmanisis Gora, a fortress \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/culture/3000-year-old-shang-city-oldest-ever-in-china\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003esettlement\u003c/a\u003e of “exceptional preservation and size, “ is indicative of the region\u0026#8217;s rich prehistory and will contribute to current understandings of how these ancient mega-structures expanded globally.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"The Return of the Ekranoplan\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/q-hr-Qc4Dz0?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"25:T8ae,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOutside the inner fortress, they detected additional fortification walls and other stone structures, according to a recent press release. Dmanisis Gora appeared even more gargantuan than they had originally thought. They needed to send in the drones as it ended up extending hundreds of acres.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the premier example in the region due to its sheer size, the study at the Dmanisis Gora will provide unmatched insights into the prehistory of the South Caucasus and global patterns of ancient “mega-structures” worldwide.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135475\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/mega-fortress-800x450-1.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eThe Dmanisis Gora site at dusk, showing the location at the convergence of two gorges / \u003ca href=\"https://www.cranfield.ac.uk/press/news-2025/mega-fortress-in-the-southern-caucasus\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eCranfield University\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-taking-to-the-skies-to-capture-over-a-hundred-acres\"\u003eTaking to the skies to capture over a hundred acres\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSituated at the convergence of two gorges, the excavations at Dmanisis Gora began on a fortified promontory between these recesses. As per a recent press release, other archaeological remains surfaced when the season permitted outside this inner fortress, which required the use of drone technology. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“That was what sparked the idea of using a drone to assess the site from the air,” Dr Erb-Satullo explained in a press release.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"26:T74b,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFifty-year-old photographs taken in the Cold War area, which have been accessible since 2013, gave researchers further information concerning any damage that the mega-ancient and significant site incurred over the years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-site-singular-in-prominence-in-the-south-caucasus\"\u003eA site singular in prominence in the South Caucasus\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAll in all, its size exceeds that of the other fortresses nearby with an added feature of a double rather than single fortification around the inner fortress, researchers explained in a recent study.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt suggests that the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/britains-butchered-bones-cannibalism-study\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eBronze Age site\u003c/a\u003e might have been singular in prominence in the South Caucasus as fortress settlements began to pop up between 1500 and 500 BCE, as per the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cranfield.ac.uk/press/news-2025/mega-fortress-in-the-southern-caucasus\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epress release\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThey hypothesize that residents resided permanently in the inner fortress. The outer layer might reflect seasonal inhabitants or an attempt to settle a large population, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/antiquity/article/megafortresses-in-the-south-caucasus-new-data-from-southern-georgia/7752B2551034811556C96E75E909D730#article\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ethe study continued\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers have continued excavating the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/culture/mexico-1375-year-old-pyramid-found\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eancient city\u003c/a\u003e. \u0026#8220;Uncovering tens of thousands of pottery shards, animal bones, and other artifacts,\u0026#8221; they are learning more about the society that built it. onboard space stations to conduct complex tasks. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTowards this, astronauts aboard China\u0026#8217;s Tiangong space station have been conducting experiments to assess human-robot interactions in the microgravity environment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Shenzhou 19 crew — comprising Cai Xuzhe, Song Lingdong, and Wang Haoze — are working alongside an intelligent robot named Xiao Hang.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis intelligent robot has been designed to navigate the microgravity environment, and capture images.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;In the future, it will also be able to perform various functions such as in-cabin inspections and resource management through upgrades,\u0026#8221; Wang Haoze, China\u0026#8217;s first female spaceflight engineer, stated, \u003cem\u003eGlobal Times\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.globaltimes.cn/page/202501/1326087.shtml\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdvanced space station robots are being developed to conduct thorough equipment inspections and maintain accurate inventory records. This will free up valuable astronaut time for more complex and demanding mission objectives.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-various-experiments-are-being-performed\"\u003eVarious experiments are being performed \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eChinese astronauts are using advanced software to experiment with human-robot interaction, aiming to improve teamwork in space.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe software enables astronauts to conduct various experiments on how humans and robots interact in space. It also allows how the astronauts and the robot interact in terms of their physical positions and movements within the space station.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoreover, they are conducting experiments to assess the robot\u0026#8217;s performance in different situations. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe software plays a crucial role in enabling experiments that aim to improve how astronauts and robots work together in space. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy studying human-robot spatial relationships, \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/innovation/china-unleashes-ostrich-like-robot\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003erobot\u003c/a\u003e behavior, and various communication methods, researchers hope to enhance the efficiency and safety of future space missions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"The Robots Are Coming\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/-CdHVDYcQ_I?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-the-crew-recently-performed-longest-spacewalk\"\u003eThe crew recently performed longest spacewalk \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Shenzhou 19 crew has been actively engaged in various scientific experiments aboard the Tiangong space station. One recent study involved the collection and observation of fruit flies. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs per \u003cem\u003eSpace.com\u003c/em\u003e, this research aims to investigate how sub-magnetic fields and the microgravity environment of space impact the development and behavior of these insects.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoreover, the crew conducted a series of experiments to study the effects of long-term spaceflight on human movement. Using specialized devices and software, they measured their fine motor skills. This research aims to better understand how astronauts adapt to the microgravity environment and how their motor control changes over extended periods in space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Shenzhou 19 crew embarked on a six-month mission to the orbital station on October 29, 2024.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn December 18, the current astronauts Xuzhe and Lingdong created a new world record for the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/space/china-record-9-hour-spacewalk\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003elongest single spacewalk\u003c/a\u003e, completing a nine-hour extravehicular activity (EVA) outside Tiangong.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis surpasses the previous record held by NASA astronauts James Voss and Susan Helms in 2001. This spacewalk lasted for 8 hours, and 56 minutes outside the space shuttle Discovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn 2022, China completed its Tiangong space station, which means “Heavenly Palace\u0026#8221; in Chinese. It currently consists of three modules. China also intends to further expand the station by adding more modules.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe space station orbits the Earth in a low Earth orbit (LEO) —\u0026nbsp; between 340 and 450 kilometers (211 to 280 miles) above Earth\u0026#8217;s surface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eChina aims to establish a long-term human presence in space with the Tiangong station, which will continuously serve as a research facility to conduct scientific exploration.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"29:T4e9,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis intelligent robot has been designed to navigate the microgravity environment, and capture images.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;In the future, it will also be able to perform various functions such as in-cabin inspections and resource management through upgrades,\u0026#8221; Wang Haoze, China\u0026#8217;s first female spaceflight engineer, stated, \u003cem\u003eGlobal Times\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.globaltimes.cn/page/202501/1326087.shtml\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdvanced space station robots are being developed to conduct thorough equipment inspections and maintain accurate inventory records. This spacewalk lasted for 8 hours, and 56 minutes outside the space shuttle Discovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn 2022, China completed its Tiangong space station, which means “Heavenly Palace\u0026#8221; in Chinese. It currently consists of three modules. China also intends to further expand the station by adding more modules.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe space station orbits the Earth in a low Earth orbit (LEO) —\u0026nbsp; between 340 and 450 kilometers (211 to 280 miles) above Earth\u0026#8217;s surface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eChina aims to establish a long-term human presence in space with the Tiangong station, which will continuously serve as a research facility to conduct scientific exploration.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"2c:T1b8c,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003c!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO Premium plugin v22.8 (Yoast has announced that its alien-like vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) V-BAT drone demonstrated its ability to electronic warfare countermeasures in Ukraine.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eShield AI also stated that the V-BAT has crossed 23 deployments, including the ones operational in Ukraine, as it delivers “Group 5 capability at Group 3 costs.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company also says that the drone is helping multiple other countries and armies carry out intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) and targeting operations around the globe. This includes its use in the Caribbean Sea to carry out anti-drug trafficking operations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eElectronic warfare is used against unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) as a countermeasure to immobilize them. Their use has been on the rise in the Russia-Ukraine war, with both sides actively using them on the front.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eV-BAT drones helping Ukrainian forces\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eShield AI had confirmed V-BAT deployment in Ukraine back in June 2024.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSince then, it has been used countless times in Ukraine, but the use has not been confirmed by either the forces or Shield AI.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“In Ukraine, V-BAT demonstrated resilience against electronic warfare, showcasing autonomy in the toughest conditions and completing the first successful long-endurance, long-duration ISR and targeting mission while GPS and comms were jammed,” the \u003ca href=\"https://shield.ai/2024-a-year-of-mission-impact-at-shield-ai/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecompany said\u003c/a\u003e in its year-ender newsletter published on December 31, 2024.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn September 2023, Shield AI \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/military/shield-ai-v-bat-drones\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e the successful demonstration of three V-BAT UAS working together autonomously.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt was achieved through the use of Hivemind AI pilot, a software that enables multiple drones to coordinate and collaborate on complex missions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe three V-BATs were used in a simulated scenario where they had to detect, identify, locate, and report (DILR) on wildfires.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe drones performed the task without relying on GPS or communications, demonstrating their potential for dual-use applications in civilian and military domains.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt is this feature that Shield AI claims has been brought into use in real-world situations in the Ukraine war.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-dnt=\"true\"\u003e\u003cp lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\"\u003eOne of the first images of a US-supplied Shield AI MQ-35A V-BAT UAV in operational Ukrainian service.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe V-BAT has reportedly completed its first long-endurance autonomous reconnaissance mission with GPS and communications jammed over the Ukrainian front. \u003ca href=\"https://t.co/XPNhK6MM9T\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epic.twitter.com/XPNhK6MM9T\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u0026mdash; OSINTtechnical (@Osinttechnical) \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/Osinttechnical/status/1878307334826471873?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eJanuary 12, 2025\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca rel=\"\" href=\"\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-shield-ai-s-drone-capabilities\"\u003eShield AI\u0026#8217;s drone capabilities\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn December 20, through a blog post, Shield AI stated that it aims to enhance the autonomy of V-BAT drones to such an extent that one operator would be able to manage up to 10 drones simultaneously.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis will be made possible by the use of autonomy in the drones, as they can respond to changing mission requirements at a fast pace.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“Autonomy in defense must reduce operator workload by enabling UAS to independently manage tasks such as loitering, communication losses, and rerouting. With high-level autonomy, V-BAT can make rapid in-theater adjustments, allowing operators to focus on mission-critical decisions rather than routine controls,” the \u003ca href=\"https://shield.ai/autonomy-for-the-world-v-bat/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecompany said\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe autonomy algorithms on the V-BAT drone operate entirely onboard, as opposed to the regular UAVs, where calculations are done at a command center.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe V-BAT drone \u003ca href=\"https://shield.ai/v-bat/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ehas a length\u003c/a\u003e of 9 feet and a wingspan of 9.7 feet – with a payload capacity of 25 lbs. The full weight of the drone (fuel + payload) can reach 125 lbs, during a mission. It has a service ceiling of 20,000 feet, and an endurance of 10+ hours, as it can vary on payload and aircraft configurations.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"2e:T4d0,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eElectronic warfare is used against unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) as a countermeasure to immobilize them. and it’s the cutest thing ever, so it broke the internet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"margin: 0px;padding: 0px\"\u003eNOAA Fisheries shared a video on X, probably knowing full well it would be a massive hit, of a baby\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eNeolithodes agassizii,\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003ecolloquially known as the “king crab,” on Wednesda\u003c/span\u003ey.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCalled the “official mascot of 2025,” the most loveable crustacean on the planet covered in spikes blew up the internet, amassing a whopping 10.4 million views in less than a week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIts unexpected appearance on the shores of our world has caught the globe’s attention; they might not have known that king crabs could be that minuscule and huggable (despite the spikes). \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMore than just a good source of protein, the King Crab species produces the cutest babies on Earth. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-twitter wp-block-embed-twitter\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\nhttps://twitter.com/NOAAFisheries/status/1876783672105267506?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1876783672105267506%7Ctwgr%5E5f7ed791fb373475a00f0a91bb38451be2efb616%7Ctwcon%5Es1_c10\u0026#038;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsweek.com%2Fviral-video-baby-king-crab-noaa-fisheries-social-media-meme-2013287\u0026#038;mx=2\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 spiky baby seated comfortably in the palm of a gloved hand has kicked off the new year to an auspicious, if not adorable, start.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNOAA explained on \u003ca href=\"https://x.com/NOAAFisheries/status/1876783672105267506?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1876783672105267506%7Ctwgr%5E5f7ed791fb373475a00f0a91bb38451be2efb616%7Ctwcon%5Es1_c10\u0026amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsweek.com%2Fviral-video-baby-king-crab-noaa-fisheries-social-media-meme-2013287\u0026amp;mx=2\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eX\u003c/a\u003e that the little critter was found “during an operation in the Gulf of Mexico, which collected samples of mesophotic and deep-sea coral species for lab rearing and propagation.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThey called it “a tiny, spiky bundle of cuteness!\u0026#8221; on \u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/NOAAFisheries/videos/466778529811742\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eFacebook\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe unforgettable crab baby of an unknown gender had a bemused expression on its face as if it didn’t exactly know how it got here but wasn’t bent out of shape about it. Maybe a little confused. \u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eNewsweek\u003c/em\u003e continued that the baby with big ambitions might have surfaced thanks to a plastic bag that was, thankfully, pulled from the seafloor in August 2024.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe baby king crab has given the world a rare chance to learn a thing or two about the life of a king crab, as it is currently attracting the world\u0026#8217;s attention. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-community-loving-crustacean-that-goes-the-distance-for-love\"\u003eA community-loving crustacean that goes the distance for love\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe world knows the king crab quite well. Their long and delicious legs tend to decorate chilled seafood platters. But they don’t start out at 4.6 inches across and 4 inches long, \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.newsweek.com/viral-video-baby-king-crab-noaa-fisheries-social-media-meme-2013287\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eNewsweek\u003c/a\u003e \u003c/em\u003econtinues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNative to Central and South America, in both the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans, the king crabs prefer to stay out of sight, about 660 to 6,230 feet below the waves. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThey begin as tiny beings even smaller than the baby that just rose to fame. Hatching from an egg tucked under a flap in their mother’s tail, they start swimming after they hatch as larvae.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOnce they settle on the seafloor, the “molting cycle” begins. As the name suggests, they take on the shape and structure of a crab at that point. It takes a few rounds for the mighty king of the crabs to develop its hard shell. So the little crab that NOAA named “hyperbole” appears to be a toddler rather than an infant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAt about two or four years old, they prefer to live a more secluded life in deeper depths, where they “hang out” in clusters of thousands.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eA tight-knit community, they even go the distance for love, according to \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.dartagnan.com/lobstergram/lg-the-history-and-life-cycle-of-the-alaskan-king-crab.html#:~:text=The%20eggs%20will%20stay%20nestled,critical%20time%20in%20their%20survival.\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDartagnan\u003c/a\u003e, \u003c/em\u003eswimming 100 miles just to mate in swallower waters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAll that might be intellectually stimulating, but the point is pretty clear here: who knew that the long-legged king \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/oldest-penis-ever-discovered-crab\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003ecrab\u003c/a\u003e started out its impressive 20-30-year life in such an unbelievably cute form that might inspire a t-shirt? \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"The Return of the Ekranoplan\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/q-hr-Qc4Dz0?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"37:T135b,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eA hidden danger may exist beneath Antarctica that could accelerate ice melt, a new study says.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAntarctica is not just a passive, icy landscape, but a geologically active region with a complex network of volcanoes — many of which remain hidden beneath the ice.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis threat exists several kilometers below the West Antarctic Ice Sheet, which is highly susceptible to the impacts of climate change.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers from Brown University conducted 4,000 computer simulations to examine how ice sheet loss influences Antarctica\u0026#8217;s buried volcanoes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“The West Antarctic Ice Sheet is particularly vulnerable to collapse, yet its position atop an active volcanic rift is seldom considered,” the study noted.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-ice-melt-could-impact-underlying-volcanoes\"\u003eIce melt could impact underlying volcanoes \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMount Erebus is one of the known active volcanoes in Antarctica with a persistent lava lake. Besides the more visible ones, Antarctica hosts at least 100 other volcanoes, reported \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://eos.org/research-spotlights/antarctic-ice-melt-may-fuel-eruptions-of-hidden-volcanoes\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eEOS.org\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome of these volcanoes are buried deep beneath the thick ice sheet, making them difficult to observe directly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEvidence suggests that the Antarctic ice sheet is melting at an alarming rate due to carbon emissions. This melting has significant consequences, not just for global sea levels, but also for the slumbering volcanoes below.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe study shows that the removal of the heavy ice sheet can majorly impact the behavior of underlying volcanoes. Moreover, the gradual ice melt may have the potential to increase both the frequency and the intensity of subglacial eruptions.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe melting of ice sheets reduces the immense pressure exerted on the underlying rock and the magma chambers within. This pressure reduction allows the magma to expand. This leads to greater pressure on the walls of its containing chamber. This increased internal pressure can destabilize the system, potentially leading to volcanic eruptions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis is similar to a soda bottle. The pressure inside keeps the carbonation dissolved. When you open the bottle, the pressure drops, and the carbonation fizzes out. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSimilarly, the reduction in pressure from ice sheet melting allows the gases dissolved within the magma to expand, increasing the overall pressure within the chamber and potentially triggering an eruption.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"Can Iceland Manage Its Erupting Volcano?\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/By0cynl9_As?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-accurate-prediction-of-sea-level-rise\"\u003eAccurate prediction of sea-level rise\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccurate predictions of future sea-level rise depend largely on the understanding of the stability of the West \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/antarctica-greening-trend-accelerated\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eAntarctic\u003c/a\u003e Ice Sheet.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor this, the models need to consider the complex two-way relationship between subglacial volcanoes and ice sheet melting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe team states that the eruptions of subglacial volcanoes might not be directly observable on the surface of the ice sheet, but its consequences would be evident.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe heat released by these eruptions can melt ice from below, which could weaken the ice sheet from within. This internal melting further reduces the pressure on the underlying volcanoes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis could create a self-perpetuating cycle where ice melt leads to more volcanic eruptions, which in turn leads to further \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/40-percent-antarctica-ice-shelves-melted\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eice melt\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“Considering the removal of km-thick ice sheets, we demonstrate that the rate of unloading influences the cumulative mass erupted and consequently the heat released into the ice,” the researchers wrote in the study paper.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“These findings provide fundamental insights into the complex volcano-ice interactions in West Antarctica and other subglacial volcanic settings,” it added.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe findings were published in the journal \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/2024GC011743\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eGeochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"38:T5a3,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers from Brown University conducted 4,000 computer simulations to examine how ice sheet loss influences Antarctica\u0026#8217;s buried volcanoes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“The West Antarctic Ice Sheet is particularly vulnerable to collapse, yet its position atop an active volcanic rift is seldom considered,” the study noted.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-ice-melt-could-impact-underlying-volcanoes\"\u003eIce melt could impact underlying volcanoes \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMount Erebus is one of the known active volcanoes in Antarctica with a persistent lava lake. Besides the more visible ones, Antarctica hosts at least 100 other volcanoes, reported \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://eos.org/research-spotlights/antarctic-ice-melt-may-fuel-eruptions-of-hidden-volcanoes\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eEOS.org\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome of these volcanoes are buried deep beneath the thick ice sheet, making them difficult to observe directly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEvidence suggests that the Antarctic ice sheet is melting at an alarming rate due to carbon emissions. Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"3c:T1598,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eChinese researchers have simulated a space operation to approach and potentially target the Starlink satellite constellation.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe team, led by Wu Yunhua, director of the aerospace control department at Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, demonstrated in a computer simulation that nearly 1,400 Starlink satellites could be approached within 12 hours using just 99 Chinese satellites.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese satellites could be equipped with lasers, microwaves, and other devices for reconnaissance, tracking, or other operations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“The potential military application value of the Starlink mega constellation has been highlighted in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. In recent years, the militarisation of space has intensified, posing a significant threat to China’s space security. It is particularly important to track and monitor its operational status,” Wu’s team stated in their paper published on January 3, as reported by \u003cem\u003eSouth China Morning Post \u003c/em\u003e(\u003cem\u003eSCMP\u003c/em\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-challenges-and-innovative-solutions\"\u003eChallenges and innovative solutions\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/space/starlink-first-direct-to-cell-phone-constellation\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eStarlink\u003c/a\u003e, operated by SpaceX, has already \u003ca href=\"https://www.space.com/spacex-starlink-satellites.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e over 6,700 satellites, with plans to expand this number significantly. Tracking such a massive constellation with limited resources poses extreme challenges. Precise orbital calculations are required to maneuver satellites close enough to detect Starlink satellites without causing accidents.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdditionally, energy-intensive equipment like lasers requires adequate sunlight for recharging, further complicating operational strategies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWu and his colleagues claim to have overcome these obstacles using a binary artificial intelligence algorithm inspired by the hunting techniques of whales, \u003cem\u003eSCMP\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3294047/chinese-scientists-simulate-hunting-starlink-satellites-orbit?module=perpetual_scroll_0\u0026amp;pgtype=article\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis algorithm helps Chinese satellites work in tandem to \u0026#8220;hunt\u0026#8221; Starlink satellites effectively. According to the team, their technology can generate a reliable action plan within two minutes, making it a significant breakthrough in space operations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe hunting behavior of whales, which channel small fish into their mouths while conserving energy, provided the foundation for this method. By mimicking this natural process, the Chinese satellites are able to perform complex tracking tasks efficiently.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-military-implications-and-future-developments\"\u003eMilitary implications and future developments\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWu’s team, known for its significant contributions to China\u0026#8217;s space defense technologies, has received more than 16 million yuan (approximately $2.2 million) in funding from the Chinese government and military. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Harbin Institute of Technology also collaborated on this research, although both institutions are under US sanctions for developing advanced military technologies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eChina is also working on building its own \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/space/china-launches-first-satellites-constellation-rival-starlink-state-media-says-2024-08-06/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esatellite constellations\u003c/a\u003e similar to Starlink. However, such developments come with risks. If these constellations are attacked, the resulting debris could endanger other space assets, including space stations. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTo address this, China and other nations are exploring the development of interceptor \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/space/china-launches-world-first-self-driving-satellites\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003esatellites\u003c/a\u003e equipped with non-destructive weapons to disable targets without creating significant debris.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWu’s work highlights the growing tensions in the militarization of space and the race to dominate satellite technology. With Starlink being a central component of SpaceX\u0026#8217;s future plans, its role in global communications and potential military applications is under increasing scrutiny.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis research underscores the complexities of space security and the challenges posed by mega constellations like Starlink. As nations race to develop countermeasures and advanced tracking technologies, the militarization of space is set to redefine global defense strategies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe research has been published in the Chinese academic journal \u003cem\u003eSystems Engineering and Electronics\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"China is Planning to Give Elon Musk a Run for His Money with 13,000 Satellites\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ucit_OXmYN4?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"3d:T53f,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese satellites could be equipped with lasers, microwaves, and other devices for reconnaissance, tracking, or other operations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“The potential military application value of the Starlink mega constellation has been highlighted in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. In recent years, the militarisation of space has intensified, posing a significant threat to China’s space security. It is particularly important to track and monitor its operational status,” Wu’s team stated in their paper published on January 3, as reported by \u003cem\u003eSouth China Morning Post \u003c/em\u003e(\u003cem\u003eSCMP\u003c/em\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-challenges-and-innovative-solutions\"\u003eChallenges and innovative solutions\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/space/starlink-first-direct-to-cell-phone-constellation\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eStarlink\u003c/a\u003e, operated by SpaceX, has already \u003ca href=\"https://www.space.com/spacex-starlink-satellites.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e over 6,700 satellites, with plans to expand this number significantly. Tracking such a massive constellation with limited resources poses extreme challenges. Precise orbital calculations are required to maneuver satellites close enough to detect Starlink satellites without causing accidents.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"3e:T5cc,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdditionally, energy-intensive equipment like lasers requires adequate sunlight for recharging, further complicating operational strategies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWu and his colleagues claim to have overcome these obstacles using a binary artificial intelligence algorithm inspired by the hunting techniques of whales, \u003cem\u003eSCMP\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3294047/chinese-scientists-simulate-hunting-starlink-satellites-orbit?module=perpetual_scroll_0\u0026amp;pgtype=article\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis algorithm helps Chinese satellites work in tandem to \u0026#8220;hunt\u0026#8221; Starlink satellites effectively. According to the team, their technology can generate a reliable action plan within two minutes, making it a significant breakthrough in space operations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe hunting behavior of whales, which channel small fish into their mouths while conserving energy, provided the foundation for this method. By mimicking this natural process, the Chinese satellites are able to perform complex tracking tasks efficiently.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-military-implications-and-future-developments\"\u003eMilitary implications and future developments\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWu’s team, known for its significant contributions to China\u0026#8217;s space defense technologies, has received more than 16 million yuan (approximately $2.2 million) in funding from the Chinese government and military. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"3f:T507,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Harbin Institute of Technology also collaborated on this research, although both institutions are under US sanctions for developing advanced military technologies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eChina is also working on building its own \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/space/china-launches-first-satellites-constellation-rival-starlink-state-media-says-2024-08-06/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esatellite constellations\u003c/a\u003e similar to Starlink.
