Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"41:T1b5b,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eCalifornia is grappling with a devastating series of wildfires, threatening lives and livelihoods across the state.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGovernor Gavin Newsom has warned that these fires could be among the worst natural disasters in U.S. history in terms of cost and scale. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe economic toll is staggering, with preliminary estimates of losses reaching hundreds of billions of dollars. Reportedly, the overall financial losses are projected to reach $250 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe wildfire situation in Los Angeles, California, remains critical. Firefighters are battling three major blazes: the Palisades, the Eaton, and the Hurst fires. These infernos have claimed at least 24 lives — with many still missing. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs per CalFire, the Palisades Fire is the most significant, having consumed over 23,713 acres and is only 13% contained. The Eaton Fire follows, burning over 14,117 acres with 27% containment. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the Hurst Fire has grown to 799 acres, it is nearly 89% contained. After scorching over 1,000 acres, the Kenneth Fire was brought under complete control.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-twitter wp-block-embed-twitter\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\"\u003e\u003cp lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\"\u003eUPDATE: Southern California wildfires progress\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8211; Kenneth Fire: 100% containment\u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8211; Sunset Fire: 100% containment \u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8211; Lidia Fire: 100% containment \u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8211; Hurst Fire: 89% containment\u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8211; Eaton Fire: 27% containment \u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8211; Palisades Fire: 11% containment\u003c/p\u003e\u0026mdash; Gavin Newsom (@GavinNewsom) \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/GavinNewsom/status/1878475443264999908?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eJanuary 12, 2025\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cscript async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003c/script\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-threat-continues-to-loom\"\u003eThreat continues to loom \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe current wildfires are a result of a prolonged dry spell coupled with strong \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/culture/wildfire-fire-spreads-us-emergency\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eSanta Ana winds\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs per \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/ckgy0pyvglpo\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBBC\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the fierce Santa Ana winds are expected to return this week, which could add more fuel to the already raging fires.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAfter a brief respite over the weekend, these fierce winds are forecast to intensify from Sunday night through Wednesday, reaching speeds of up to 60 mph (96km/h).\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFirefighters from across the country, as well as Canada and Mexico, are assisting local crews in battling the blazes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"799\" height=\"533\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/54254691698_d5930ef1e9_c.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135447\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/54254691698_d5930ef1e9_c.jpg 799w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/54254691698_d5930ef1e9_c.jpg?resize=300,200 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/54254691698_d5930ef1e9_c.jpg?resize=768,512 768w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 799px) 100vw, 799px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eA firefighter working to contain Palisades Fire. \u003ca href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/calfire/54257383389/\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eCalFire\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe firefighting effort in Southern California involves a massive deployment of 14,000 firefighters. They are supported by 84 aircraft and 1,354 fire engines in the battle against the wildfires.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTens of thousands of residents remain under evacuation orders or warnings as the fires continue to threaten communities. Roughly 105,000 residents are currently mandated to evacuate, and 87,000 are under evacuation warnings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEvacuation centers are set up to provide shelter and support to those displaced.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe wildfires have tragically resulted in 16 fatalities linked to the Eaton Fire and eight to the Palisades Fire. Search and rescue operations for missing individuals are also underway. \u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"How technology is reshaping the future of wildfires\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3FhbtsVaRUA?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-wildlife-severely-impacted\"\u003eWildlife severely impacted  \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe fires have caused widespread devastation, destroying thousands of homes, businesses, and places of worship.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe wildfires have already destroyed more than 12,000 structures. Sadly, officials anticipate that this number will continue to rise in the coming days.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNew fires erupted on Sunday, posing a threat to communities in the San Fernando Valley and the vicinity of NASA\u0026#8217;s Jet Propulsion Laboratory. The new fires ignited within the Angeles National Forest were successfully contained by the firefighters. This protected the vital research facility.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOver 24,000 individuals have already submitted applications for disaster assistance to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eReports indicate that some fire hydrants ran dry during the initial firefighting efforts, raising concerns about the water supply.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs per \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/newsom-california-wildfires-worst-natural-disaster-us-history-rcna187313\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eNBC News\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, President-elect Donald Trump criticized Newsom and President Joe Biden due to the absence of water in fire hydrants. He posted on Truth Social: “NO WATER IN THE FIRE HYDRANTS, NO MONEY IN FEMA. THIS IS WHAT JOE BIDEN IS LEAVING ME. THANKS JOE!”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe fight against these devastating fires continues. These catastrophic wildfires have severely impacted \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/wildfires-giant-sloths-mammoths-pleistocene\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003ewildlife\u003c/a\u003e also. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOver 400 animals, including dogs, horses, donkeys, goats, and sheep, have been brought to the Pasadena Humane facility since the Southern California wildfires began. Reportedly, animal shelters, veterinarians, and rescue organizations are working together to provide care and assistance to these displaced animals and their owners.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"42:T44e,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cul\u003e\r\n \t\u003cli\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"lSfe4c r5bEn accurately predict wildfires\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv role=\"heading\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv wildfire situation in Los Angeles, California, remains critical. Firefighters are battling three major blazes: the Palisades, the Eaton, and the Hurst fires. These infernos have claimed at least 24 lives — with many still missing. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs per CalFire, the Palisades Fire is the most significant, having consumed over 23,713 acres and is only 13% contained. The Eaton Fire follows, burning over 14,117 acres with 27% containment. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the Hurst Fire has grown to 799 acres, it is nearly 89% contained. After scorching over 1,000 acres, the Kenneth Fire was brought under complete control.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-twitter \u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe current wildfires are a result of a prolonged dry spell coupled with strong \u003ca Sunday night through Wednesday, reaching speeds of up to 60 mph (96km/h).\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFirefighters from across the country, as well as Canada and Mexico, are assisting / Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"49:T3cd5,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eCOVID-19 was declared a global pandemic in March 2020. The unprecedented outbreak of the viral disease exposed shortcomings of public health management systems the world over. Countries across the globe implemented drastic measures, ranging from quarantines and social-distancing protocols to border closures and to curb the spread of the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIndividuals who had undertaken travel or been exposed to infected persons were required to isolate themselves for extended periods to reduce community transmission. In some countries, authorities adopted strategies such as public disclosure of identities and locations of those in isolation to enforce compliance. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSuch measures raised questions surrounding ethical boundaries of disease surveillance. More importantly, the pandemic prompted an in-depth look into existing diagnostic tools and surveillance mechanisms. Five years later, humanity stands at the cusp of a difficult trade-off between safety and privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-key-epidemiological-tool\"\u003eA key epidemiological tool\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy definition, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/medicine-and-dentistry/disease-surveillance\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003edisease surveillance\u003c/a\u003e is \u0026#8220;ongoing, systematic, collection, analysis and interpretation of health data essential to the planning, implementation and evaluation of public health practice, closely integrated with the timely dissemination of these data to those who need to know.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eInfectious disease surveillance is a key epidemiological tool for monitoring diseases, identifying outbreaks, and detecting emerging pathogens. These efforts can rely on traditional forms of surveillance as well as innovative approaches, such as mobile apps and other combination of digital tools. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7563794/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ezoonoses\u003c/a\u003e—diseases transmitted from animals to humans—pose a significant threat to global health, as demonstrated by COVID-19. \u003ca href=\"https://www.emro.who.int/fr/about-who/rc61/zoonotic-diseases.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to the WHO\u003c/a\u003e, there are more than 200 known types of zoonoses. It is estimated that approximately 60% of emerging infectious diseases reported worldwide are zoonoses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome zoonotic diseases, such as rabies, are completely preventable through vaccination. Identifying zoonotic \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/pathogens-use-force-to-bypass-the-immune-system-new-research-says\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003epathogens\u003c/a\u003e in animal populations before they are transmitted to humans enables rapid interventions. Zoonoses know no borders; international cooperation is therefore essential. Nevertheless, differences in surveillance capabilities and data-sharing practices can prevent coordinated responses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-vulnerabilities-of-existing-systems\"\u003eVulnerabilities of existing systems\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite collective acceptance on importance of disease surveillance, the recent pandemic has exposed significant shortcomings. In a \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2213398424003981\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e published in late 2024, scientists assessed the landscape of the 1918 influenza pandemic and the 2019 coronavirus pandemic, mapping potential surveillance sites for the emergence and re-emergence of infectious diseases in Ghana. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe results of the study highlighted the critical importance of strengthening the infectious disease surveillance system. As the researchers pointed out, socioeconomic routes and population density exacerbate the spread of disease, requiring a proactive approach to surveillance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn an interview with \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e, lead study author \u003ca href=\"https://www.researchgate.net/lab/Peter-N-jonaam-Mahama-Lab\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ePeter N-jonaam Mahama\u003c/a\u003e of the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering, School of Engineering, University of Energy and Natural Resources, Ghana, noted that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic has underlined vulnerabilities in existing systems, including mechanisms of delayed detection and response. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eN-jonaam Mahama observed that while significant lessons have been learned from the 1918 influenza and 2019 coronavirus pandemics, it is clear that much more needs to be studied and applied to fully address vulnerabilities in infectious disease surveillance systems, especially in resource-constrained settings. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese pandemics, according to N-jonaam Mahama, pointed to several key shortcomings, such as delayed detection, and inadequate response mechanisms. He said that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic also highlighted several gaps. For example, many countries did not heed early warnings about \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/who-covid-19-pandemic-not-lab-grown\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eCOVID-19\u003c/a\u003e quickly enough.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-modern-technologies\"\u003eModern technologies\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhen asked what modern technologies have the potential to improve zoonotic surveillance, or how innovations can be used to prevent, detect, and control zoonotic outbreaks, N-jonaam Mahama explained that health apps can enable veterinarians to report cases or unusual animal deaths in real-time, while geographic information systems can help in the analysis. \u0026#8220;Innovations in technology, when integrated with the \u003ca href=\"https://www.who.int/health-topics/one-health#tab=tab_1\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eOne Health approach\u003c/a\u003e, can revolutionize zoonotic control,\u0026#8221; added N-jonaam Mahama.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe also noted the importance of satellite imagery and drones that can monitor environmental changes that affect zoonotic risks. For example, the destruction of natural habitats can increase contact between wild animals and humans. That increases the risk of zoonotic transmission. N-jonaam Mahama also highlighted the importance of biosensors that can detect changes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-biosensors-for-disease-surveillance\"\u003eBiosensors for disease surveillance\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors play a crucial role in monitoring infectious diseases. They allow rapid detection of pathogens, which can significantly speed up the response of health authorities to disease outbreaks, especially when it comes to preventing further spread. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780443216589000188\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ewearable biosensors\u003c/a\u003e—like smart bracelets—can monitor vital parameters and notify healthcare workers real time. Although biosensors have enormous potential, their application also carries certain challenges. Namely, they require appropriate data protection measures to ensure user privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135427\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eThe use of pulse oximeters became commonplace during the pandemic Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/a-black-woman-measures-her-oxygen-level-at-home-using-a-pulse-oximeter-gm1453983148-489766379\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003evgajic/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S016599362400462X#sec3\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eIn a 2024 study that focused on biosensors\u003c/a\u003e, it was found that infectious diseases are responsible for almost 15% of deaths in the world. Faster detection enables quicker introduction of preventive measures. That\u0026#8217;s why early detection of pathogens ensures time-efficient medical interventions and more effective disease management. Studies state that the advent of biosensors has enabled the rapid and accurate detection of various pathogens, real-time and on-site.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOne of the corresponding authors of the study is \u003ca href=\"https://kuttam.ku.edu.tr/en/our-staff/academic-staff/faculty-members/mehmet-cengiz-onbasli/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDr Mehmet Cengiz Onbaşlı\u003c/a\u003e from the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at Koç University, Turkey. According to him, COVID-19 has certainly accelerated the development of new biosensors. He pointed to the tens of thousands of new research papers on biosensors every year—about 15,000 to 20,000—and of these, 2,000 to 3,000 are novel or significant enough for potential clinical translation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;When we consider clinical trials, we observe an even smaller fraction of them being translated each year into clinical medical device studies,\u0026#8221; said Cengiz Onbaşlı speaking to \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e. Giving an example, he underscored that a search on \u003ca href=\"https://clinicaltrials.gov/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eClinicalTrials.gov\u003c/a\u003e or other reliable databases revealed only about 10 to 15 clinical trials per year for biomedical devices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-the-role-of-al\"\u003eThe role of Al\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlthough biosensors are important for the detection of pathogens in real-time, artificial intelligence can help in the analysis of huge amounts of data. AI can be used wisely to avoid the kinds of pitfalls that could lead to wrong clinical decisions. “For instance, if you use biosensors with AI for population-scale screening, you would have to make high-specificity and high-sensitivity measurements or classifications to obtain reliable decision points,” said Cengiz Onbaşlı. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGood decisions will therefore require optimized models based on good data. Good data essentially means that it is collected and processed systematically. “We need physicians and seasoned healthcare administrators who will make wise decisions based on common or potential pitfalls of using AI. That\u0026#8217;s why I\u0026#8217;m rather cautious about relying on AI too much, but not integrating it to avoid wrong decisions is also a poor way of thinking,” concluded Cengiz Onbaşlı.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135428\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eRepresentational image of coronavirus mutation. Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/covid-19-new-mutation-variant-pirola-gm1677819202-536411478\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ekoto_feja/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the study co-authored by Cengiz Onbaşlı, while significant progress has been made in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of infectious diseases over the past century, the lack of early detection remains a major obstacle. The lack of early detection of diseases makes it difficult to implement timely interventions, which can generally increase the risk of spread. As per Cengiz Onbaşlı, this is a major concern.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn his opinion, population screening studies require appropriate statistical sampling of communities to ensure early monitoring of disease outbreaks or local epidemics. \u0026#8220;That requires local health authorities to use sensor tools with the appropriate administrative approach, and communities really need to cooperate in conducting population-wide screenings or at least sampling-scale efforts,\u0026#8221; he stated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-privacy-concerns\"\u003ePrivacy concerns\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors are empowering medical professionals to unlock intricacies of the human body, detect diseases in their earliest stages, and move us closer to a future where healthcare is not just a reactive response, but a proactive and personalized endeavor. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn general, when it comes to disease surveillance technologies, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10194177/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ethe issue of privacy\u003c/a\u003e is also pertinent in the interaction between medicine and engineering. As N-jonaam Mahama noted, engineers having access to health data to develop and test applications is important, but privacy concerns and lack of standardized protocols can hinder progress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe use of biosensors involves the collection, transmission, and analysis of sensitive personal health data. Sharing data real-time can expose individuals to challenges such as discrimination based on health status. Hence, it is crucial to ensure that the data is protected and accessible only to authorized persons. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis requires establishing secure data storage facilities to protect against potential breach, as well as implementing strict privacy policies to maintain patient confidentiality. Therefore, there is a need to be transparent in how data is employed, meaning users should be able to control how their data is shared and for what purposes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-question-of-life-and-death\"\u003eA question of life and death\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of disease surveillance in public health. Biosensors and health apps have enormous potential in ensuring early detection. \u003ca href=\"https://www.preventionweb.net/publication/changing-face-pandemic-risk-2024-report\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to an October 2024 report\u003c/a\u003e, 17 outbreaks of dangerous diseases were recorded in 2024 alone. The growing risk of a new pandemic has also put forth concerns over health privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSociety\u0026#8217;s failure to comply with life-saving measures leaves room for more drastic measures, which sometimes includes privacy violations. With viruses being fatal for large swathes of population, the question that rises is if violation of privacy is a small price? The issue is not only a matter of technological progress and science, but literally of life and death. The balance between health and privacy needs to be achieved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"4a:T4a4,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSuch measures raised questions surrounding ethical boundaries of disease surveillance. More importantly, the pandemic prompted an in-depth look into existing diagnostic tools and surveillance mechanisms. Five years later, humanity stands at the cusp of a difficult trade-off between safety and privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-key-epidemiological-tool\"\u003eA key epidemiological tool\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy definition, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/medicine-and-dentistry/disease-surveillance\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003edisease surveillance\u003c/a\u003e is \u0026#8220;ongoing, systematic, collection, analysis and interpretation of health data essential to the planning, implementation and evaluation of public health practice, closely integrated with the timely dissemination of these data to those who need to know.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eInfectious disease surveillance is a key epidemiological tool for monitoring diseases, identifying outbreaks, and detecting emerging pathogens. Nevertheless, differences in surveillance capabilities and data-sharing practices can prevent coordinated responses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-vulnerabilities-of-existing-systems\"\u003eVulnerabilities of existing systems\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite collective acceptance on importance of disease surveillance, the recent pandemic has exposed significant shortcomings. In a \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2213398424003981\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e published in late 2024, scientists assessed the landscape of the 1918 influenza pandemic and the 2019 coronavirus pandemic, mapping potential surveillance sites for the emergence and re-emergence of infectious diseases in Ghana. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"4c:T46c,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe results of the study highlighted the critical importance of strengthening the infectious disease surveillance system. He said that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic also highlighted several gaps. For example, many countries did not heed early warnings about \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/who-covid-19-pandemic-not-lab-grown\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eCOVID-19\u003c/a\u003e quickly enough.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-modern-technologies\"\u003eModern technologies\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhen asked what modern technologies have the potential to improve zoonotic surveillance, or how innovations can be used to prevent, detect, and control zoonotic outbreaks, N-jonaam Mahama explained that health apps can enable veterinarians to report cases or unusual animal deaths in real-time, while geographic information systems can help in the analysis. \u0026#8220;Innovations in technology, when integrated with the \u003ca href=\"https://www.who.int/health-topics/one-health#tab=tab_1\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eOne Health approach\u003c/a\u003e, can revolutionize zoonotic control,\u0026#8221; added N-jonaam Mahama.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe also noted the importance of satellite imagery and drones that can monitor environmental changes that affect zoonotic risks. For example, the destruction of natural habitats can increase contact between wild animals and humans. That increases the risk of zoonotic transmission. N-jonaam Mahama also highlighted the importance of biosensors that can detect changes.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"4e:T9ef,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-biosensors-for-disease-surveillance\"\u003eBiosensors for disease surveillance\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors play a crucial role in monitoring infectious diseases. They allow rapid detection of pathogens, which can significantly speed up the response of health authorities to disease outbreaks, especially when it comes to preventing further spread. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780443216589000188\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ewearable biosensors\u003c/a\u003e—like smart bracelets—can monitor vital parameters and notify healthcare workers real time. Although biosensors have enormous potential, their application also carries certain challenges. Namely, they require appropriate data protection measures to ensure user privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135427\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eThe use of pulse oximeters became commonplace during the pandemic Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/a-black-woman-measures-her-oxygen-level-at-home-using-a-pulse-oximeter-gm1453983148-489766379\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003evgajic/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S016599362400462X#sec3\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eIn a 2024 study that focused on biosensors\u003c/a\u003e, it was found that infectious diseases are responsible for almost 15% of deaths in the world. Faster detection enables quicker introduction of preventive measures. That\u0026#8217;s why early detection of pathogens ensures time-efficient medical interventions and more effective disease management. Studies state that the advent of biosensors has enabled the rapid and accurate detection of various pathogens, real-time and on-site.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"4f:T47f,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOne of the corresponding authors of the study is \u003ca href=\"https://kuttam.ku.edu.tr/en/our-staff/academic-staff/faculty-members/mehmet-cengiz-onbasli/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDr Mehmet Cengiz Onbaşlı\u003c/a\u003e from the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at Koç University, Turkey. According to him, COVID-19 has certainly accelerated the development of new biosensors. He pointed to the tens of thousands of new research papers on biosensors every year—about 15,000 to 20,000—and of these, 2,000 to 3,000 are novel or significant enough for potential clinical translation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;When we consider clinical trials, we observe an even smaller fraction of them being translated each year into clinical medical device studies,\u0026#8221; said Cengiz Onbaşlı speaking to \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e. Giving an example, he underscored that a search on \u003ca href=\"https://clinicaltrials.gov/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eClinicalTrials.gov\u003c/a\u003e or other reliable databases revealed only about 10 to 15 clinical trials per year for biomedical devices.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"50:T423,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-the-role-of-al\"\u003eThe role of Al\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlthough biosensors are important for the detection of pathogens in real-time, artificial intelligence can help in the analysis of huge amounts of data. AI can be used wisely to avoid the kinds of pitfalls that could lead to wrong clinical decisions. “For instance, if you use biosensors with AI for population-scale screening, you would have to make high-specificity and high-sensitivity measurements or classifications to obtain reliable decision points,” said Cengiz Onbaşlı. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGood decisions will therefore require optimized models based on good data. Good data essentially means that it is collected and processed systematically. “We need physicians and seasoned healthcare administrators who will make wise decisions based on common or potential pitfalls of using AI. That\u0026#8217;s why I\u0026#8217;m rather cautious about relying on AI too much, but not integrating it to avoid wrong decisions is also a poor way of thinking,” concluded Cengiz Onbaşlı.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"51:T8bd,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135428\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eRepresentational image of coronavirus mutation. Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/covid-19-new-mutation-variant-pirola-gm1677819202-536411478\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ekoto_feja/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the study co-authored by Cengiz Onbaşlı, while significant progress has been made in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of infectious diseases over the past century, the lack of early detection remains a major obstacle. The lack of early detection of diseases makes it difficult to implement timely interventions, which can generally increase the risk of spread. As per Cengiz Onbaşlı, this is a major concern.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn his opinion, population screening studies require appropriate statistical sampling of communities to ensure early monitoring of disease outbreaks or local epidemics. \u0026#8220;That requires local health authorities to use sensor tools with the appropriate administrative approach, and communities really need to cooperate in conducting population-wide screenings or at least sampling-scale efforts,\u0026#8221; he stated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-privacy-concerns\"\u003ePrivacy concerns\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors are empowering medical professionals to unlock intricacies of the human body, detect diseases in their earliest stages, and move us closer to a future where healthcare is not just a reactive response, but a proactive and personalized endeavor. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"52:T484,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn general, when it comes to disease surveillance technologies, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10194177/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ethe issue of privacy\u003c/a\u003e is also pertinent in the interaction between medicine and engineering. As N-jonaam Mahama noted, engineers having access to health data to develop and test applications is important, but privacy concerns and lack of standardized protocols can hinder progress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe use of biosensors involves the collection, transmission, and analysis of sensitive personal health data. Sharing data real-time can expose individuals to challenges such as discrimination based on health status. Hence, it is crucial to ensure that the data is protected and accessible only to authorized persons. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis requires establishing secure data storage facilities to protect against potential breach, as well as implementing strict privacy policies to maintain patient confidentiality. Therefore, there is a need to be transparent in how data is employed, meaning users should be able to control how their data is shared and for what purposes.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"53:T43d,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-question-of-life-and-death\"\u003eA question of life and death\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of disease surveillance in public health. Biosensors and health apps have enormous potential in ensuring early detection. \u003ca href=\"https://www.preventionweb.net/publication/changing-face-pandemic-risk-2024-report\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to an October 2024 report\u003c/a\u003e, 17 outbreaks of dangerous diseases were recorded in 2024 alone. The growing risk of a new pandemic has also put forth concerns over health privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSociety\u0026#8217;s failure to comply with life-saving measures leaves room for more drastic measures, which sometimes includes privacy violations. With viruses being fatal for large swathes of population, the question that rises is if violation of privacy is a small price? The issue is not only a matter of technological progress and science, but literally of life and death. The balance between health and privacy needs to be achieved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"54:T1e46,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003c!-- This site is optimized with the Engineering\"},\"image\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#/schema/logo/image/\"},\"sameAs\":[\"https://www.facebook.com/interestingengineering/\",\"https://x.com/IntEngineering\",\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/interestingengineering/\"],\"email\":\"contact@interestingengineering.com\",\"numberOfEmployees\":{\"@type\":\"QuantitativeValue\",\"minValue\":\"201\",\"maxValue\":\"500\"},\"publishingPrinciples\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/home-page\"}]}\u003c/script\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video\" content=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ky_XneE3I-Y\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:type\" content=\"text/html\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:duration\" content=\"401\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:width\" content=\"480\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:height\" content=\"270\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"ya:ovs:adult\" Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"55:T12e9,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eA secret cache of treasure, comprising burial crowns and insignia belonging to Polish and Lithuanian rulers, has been uncovered after more than 85 years from Vilnius Cathedral in Lithuania.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHidden since the onset of World War II in 1939, the cache from the catholic cathedral was highlighted in a press release by Go Vilnius tourism promotion agency on Wednesday. The collection includes a crown that belonged to Alexander Jagiellon, also known as Aleksandras Jogailaitis, the king of Poland and grand duke of Lithuania, who lived from 1461 to 1506.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-insignia-sheds-light-on-historic-craftsmanship\"\u003eInsignia sheds light on historic craftsmanship\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/photo-story/grave-uncovered-barbarian-artifacts\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eburial insignia\u003c/a\u003e of Lithuanian and Polish monarchs are invaluable historical artefacts. They represent Lithuania\u0026#8217;s enduring statehood, Vilnius\u0026#8217;s significance as the capital, and exceptional craftsmanship in goldsmithing and jewelry, according to Vilnius Archbishop Gintaras Grušas in a statement \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2025/01/09/style/royal-crowns-vilnius-scli-intl/index.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eshared\u003c/a\u003e with \u003cem\u003eCNN\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe collection also features a crown, a chain, a medallion, a ring, and a coffin plaque linked to Elizabeth of Austria, known as Elžbieta Habsburgaitė, who lived from 1436 to 1505.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdditionally, the artifacts include a separate crown, a scepter, an orb, three rings, a chain, and coffin plaques associated with Barbara Radziwiłł, or Barbora Radvilaitė. Married to Sigismund II Augustus, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, she passed away in 1551.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe artifacts were likely placed inside the sarcophagi of the royals as part of their burial rites. The crowns were not intended to be worn but were crafted posthumously to adorn the burial tomb, according to the statement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis reflects the practice of honoring the deceased in medieval Europe and underscores Vilnius Cathedral\u0026#8217;s significance as the necropolis for the elite of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, the statement from Archbishop Grušas read further.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-crypt-discovery-ends-decades-long-mystery\"\u003eCrypt discovery ends decades-long mystery \u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe items were initially unearthed in 1931 during a post-flood cleaning of Vilnius \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/culture/the-39-greatest-constructions-of-gothic-architecture-in-the-world\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eCathedral\u003c/a\u003e, which led to the discovery of a crypt containing the remains of the rulers. They were on display until 1939, after which the outbreak of \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/lists/7-technological-innovations-that-came-out-of-world-war-ii\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eWorld War II \u003c/a\u003eprompted their concealment, in order to protect artifacts from potential looting or destruction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEfforts to find the hidden treasures increased over the last few years. In 2009, the Polish ministry collaborated with Lithuanian heritage organizations and received permission from the archdiocese for non-invasive research using tools like ground-penetrating radar, thermal imaging, and metal detectors. However, these efforts did not produce any results. The focus on finding the crypts resumed again in September last year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"How Did Shermans Defeat the Superior Tiger I?\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ky_XneE3I-Y?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe artifacts were finally recovered in December using an endoscopic camera. The were found wrapped in newspapers dated September 1939. The items are set to undergo examination and restoration before being put on public display, according to the archdiocese.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;These symbols are important both for the State and for each of us, as signs of European identity, as a reclaimed identity of the old State, as a sign of the strength of our roots,\u0026#8221; \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2025/01/09/style/royal-crowns-vilnius-scli-intl/index.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e Rita Pauliukevičiūtė, director of the Vilnius Church Heritage Museum, in a statement released by the archdiocese.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"56:T5d0,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-insignia-sheds-light-on-historic-craftsmanship\"\u003eInsignia sheds light on historic craftsmanship\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/photo-story/grave-uncovered-barbarian-artifacts\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eburial insignia\u003c/a\u003e of Lithuanian and Polish monarchs are invaluable historical artefacts. They represent Lithuania\u0026#8217;s enduring statehood, Vilnius\u0026#8217;s significance as the capital, and exceptional craftsmanship in goldsmithing and jewelry, according to Vilnius Archbishop Gintaras Grušas in a statement \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2025/01/09/style/royal-crowns-vilnius-scli-intl/index.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eshared\u003c/a\u003e with \u003cem\u003eCNN\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe collection also features a crown, a chain, a medallion, a ring, and a coffin plaque linked to Elizabeth of Austria, known as Elžbieta Habsburgaitė, who lived from 1436 to 1505.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdditionally, the artifacts include a separate crown, a scepter, an orb, three rings, a chain, and coffin plaques associated with Barbara Radziwiłł, or Barbora Radvilaitė. Married to Sigismund II Augustus, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, she passed away in 1551.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe artifacts were likely placed inside the sarcophagi of the royals as part of their burial rites. The crowns were not intended to be worn but were crafted posthumously to adorn the burial tomb, according to the statement.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"57:T5c0,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis reflects the practice of honoring the deceased in medieval Europe and underscores Vilnius Cathedral\u0026#8217;s significance as the necropolis for the elite of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, the statement from Archbishop Grušas read further.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-crypt-discovery-ends-decades-long-mystery\"\u003eCrypt discovery ends decades-long mystery \u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe items were initially unearthed in 1931 during a post-flood cleaning of Vilnius \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/culture/the-39-greatest-constructions-of-gothic-architecture-in-the-world\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eCathedral\u003c/a\u003e, which led to the discovery of a crypt containing the remains of the rulers. They were on display until 1939, after which the outbreak of \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/lists/7-technological-innovations-that-came-out-of-world-war-ii\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eWorld War II \u003c/a\u003eprompted their concealment, in order to protect artifacts from potential looting or destruction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEfforts to find the hidden treasures increased over the last few years. In 2009, the Polish ministry collaborated with Lithuanian heritage organizations and received permission from the archdiocese for non-invasive research using tools like ground-penetrating radar, thermal imaging, and metal detectors. However, these efforts did not produce any results. The focus on finding the crypts resumed again in September last year.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"58:T522,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"How Did Shermans Defeat the Superior Tiger I?\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ky_XneE3I-Y?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe artifacts were finally recovered in December using an endoscopic camera. The were found wrapped in newspapers dated September 1939. The items are set to undergo examination and restoration before being put on public display, according to the archdiocese.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;These symbols are important both for the State and for each of us, as signs of European identity, as a reclaimed identity of the old State, as a sign of the strength of our roots,\u0026#8221; \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2025/01/09/style/royal-crowns-vilnius-scli-intl/index.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e Rita Pauliukevičiūtė, director of the Vilnius Church Heritage Museum, in a statement released by the archdiocese.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"59:T1d4c,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003c!-- This site is optimized with the / Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"5a:T10dc,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eAn airport in Europe has deployed an autonomous shuttle service. Called Robobus, the autonomous mobility solution is the latest addition at the Zurich Airport. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDeveloped by WeRide, the Robobus can accommodate nine passengers. This is also the first commercial autonomous bus shuttle project at a European airport.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIt will serve airport employees along a dedicated route connecting the employee entrance at gate 101 to the maintenance area at gate 130. The Robobus service will begin in the first quarter of 2025, according to WeRide. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-robobus-provided-efficient-shuttle-services\"\u003eRobobus provided efficient shuttle services\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Zurich Airport service follows the successful \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/ces-2025/volvo-pushes-for-accelerated-shift-to-zero-emission-transport\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003edeployment\u003c/a\u003e in Paris, where Robobus provided efficient shuttle services on a five-kilometer route during the French Open, as part of an ongoing collaboration with Renault Group to promote low-carbon public transportation solutions, according to \u003ca href=\"https://ir.weride.ai/news-releases/news-release-details/weride-expands-european-presence-autonomous-robobus-shuttle\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eWeRide\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e“WeRide possesses a fully developed and thoroughly tested \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/videos/student-tricks-autonomous-bus-into-thinking-he-is-a-banana\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003etechnology\u003c/a\u003e, meets all of the legal and safety requirements in place at Zurich Airport and guarantees that it will meet the data protection requirements set out,” Flughafen Zürich AG said in a statement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-without-steering-wheels-or-driver-cabins\"\u003eWithout steering wheels or driver cabins\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWeRide deployed the Robobus in partnership with Flughafen Zürich AG and Swiss Transit Lab (STL), marking a significant \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/photo-story/electric-water-taxis-for-coastal-cities\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003emilestone\u003c/a\u003e in bringing autonomous mobility solutions to a major European aviation hub.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe company claims that the fully driverless L4 Robobus was the first to be designed for mass production and launch as dìver-out Robobus service to the public.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8220;We teamed up with Yutong Group to manufacture the Robobus. Our Robobus represents a new form of urban \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/photo-story/kafd-metro-station-riyadh\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003emobility\u003c/a\u003e that can be deployed in a variety of public and private transportation scenarios. For public transport in urban settings, our Robobus was designed to handle open roads in all weather conditions,\u0026#8221; said WeRide in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.weride.ai/products#robobus\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-world-s-first-purpose-built-autonomous-minibus\"\u003eWorld\u0026#8217;s first purpose-built autonomous minibus\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;We designed our Robobus to provide a fully autonomous driving experience without steering wheels or driver cabins. The Robobus has a top speed of 24 mph with full V2X compatibility,\u0026#8221; added WeRide.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe company claims that Robobus is the world\u0026#8217;s first purpose-built autonomous minibus designed for open urban roads. It has L4 full-stack hardware and software solution and doesn\u0026#8217;t have any steering wheel, brake pedal, or accelerator pedal. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIts pure electric range is up to 200 km, and Robobus also provides 360° blind-spot-free perception.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWeRide revealed that at the foot of the Alps, Zurich Airport presents severe challenges to autonomous driving technology due to complex operational environment and climatic conditions. The company maintained that it successfully overcame these challenges with its strong technical capabilities and rich implementation experience, providing a mature and reliable solution.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company claims that the latest step is built on WeRide\u0026#8217;s successful European operations, including its recent autonomous shuttle service at Roland-Garros during the 2024 French Open.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"5b:T487,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cul\u003e\r\n \t\u003cli class=\"LC20lb and safety requirements in place at Zurich Airport and guarantees that it will meet the data protection requirements set out,” Flughafen Zürich AG said in a statement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 with Flughafen Zürich AG and Swiss Transit Lab (STL), marking a significant \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/photo-story/electric-water-taxis-for-coastal-cities\"  target=\"_blank\" Robobus was the first to be designed for mass production and launch as dìver-out Robobus service to the public.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u0026#8220;We teamed up with Yutong Group to manufacture the Robobus. Our Robobus represents a new form of urban \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/photo-story/kafd-metro-station-riyadh\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003emobility\u003c/a\u003e that can be deployed in a variety of public and private transportation scenarios. For public transport in urban settings, our Robobus was designed to handle open roads in all weather conditions,\u0026#8221; said WeRide in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.weride.ai/products#robobus\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"5d:T45b,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-world-s-first-purpose-built-autonomous-minibus\"\u003eWorld\u0026#8217;s first purpose-built autonomous minibus\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;We designed our Robobus to provide a fully autonomous driving experience without steering wheels or driver cabins. The Robobus has a top speed of 24 mph with full V2X compatibility,\u0026#8221; added WeRide.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe company claims that Robobus is the world\u0026#8217;s first purpose-built autonomous minibus designed for open urban roads. It has L4 full-stack hardware and software solution and doesn\u0026#8217;t have any steering wheel, brake pedal, or accelerator pedal. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIts pure electric range is up to 200 km, and Robobus also provides 360° blind-spot-free perception.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWeRide revealed that at the foot of the Alps, Zurich Airport presents severe challenges to autonomous driving technology due to complex operational environment and climatic conditions. The company maintained that it successfully overcame these challenges with its strong technical capabilities and rich implementation experience, providing a mature and reliable solution.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"5e:T487,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003cul\u003e\r\n \t\u003cli class=\"LC20lb MBeuO DKV0Md\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/innovation/self-driving-vehicles-for-urban-mobility-deployed-in-european-smart-cities\"\u003eSelf-Driving Vehicles for Urban Mobility Deployed in ...\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n \t\u003cli class=\"LC20lb MBeuO DKV0Md\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/transportation/san-francisco-launches-driverless-bus-services-on-treasure-island\"\u003eSan Francisco launches driverless bus services on ...\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n \t\u003cli class=\"LC20lb MBeuO DKV0Md\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/transportation/scotland-launch-worlds-first-self-driving-commuter-bus-fleet\"\u003eScotland to launch the world's first self-driving commuter ...\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"notranslate HGLrXd NJjxre iUh30 ojE3Fb\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"q0vns\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"eqA2re UnOTSe Vwoesf\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"notranslate HGLrXd NJjxre iUh30 ojE3Fb\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"q0vns\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"eqA2re UnOTSe Vwoesf\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"notranslate HGLrXd NJjxre iUh30 ojE3Fb\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"q0vns\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"eqA2re UnOTSe Vwoesf\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\u0026nbsp;"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"5f:T1bcd,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003c!-- violations?\",\"breadcrumb\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/privacy-backseat-pandemic-prevention#breadcrumb\"},\"inLanguage\":\"en-US\",\"potentialAction\":[{\"@type\":\"ReadAction\",\"target\":[\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/privacy-backseat-pandemic-prevention\"]}]},{\"@type\":\"ImageObject\",\"inLanguage\":\"en-US\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/privacy-backseat-pandemic-prevention#primaryimage\",\"url\":\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-19971492401.jpg\",\"contentUrl\":\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-19971492401.jpg\",\"width\":1920,\"height\":1080},{\"@type\":\"BreadcrumbList\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/privacy-backseat-pandemic-prevention#breadcrumb\",\"itemListElement\":[{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":1,\"name\":\"News\",\"item\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":2,\"name\":\"Health\",\"item\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/category/health\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":3,\"name\":\"A pandemics\"}]},{\"@type\":\"WebSite\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#website\",\"url\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/\",\"name\":\"Interesting Engineering\",\"description\":\"\",\"publisher\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#organization\"},\"potentialAction\":[{\"@type\":\"SearchAction\",\"target\":{\"@type\":\"EntryPoint\",\"urlTemplate\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/?s={search_term_string}\"},\"query-input\":\"required
