/ Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"ce:T3cd5,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eCOVID-19 was declared a global pandemic in March 2020. The unprecedented outbreak of the viral disease exposed shortcomings of public health management systems the world over. Countries across the globe implemented drastic measures, ranging from quarantines and social-distancing protocols to border closures and to curb the spread of the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIndividuals who had undertaken travel or been exposed to infected persons were required to isolate themselves for extended periods to reduce community transmission. In some countries, authorities adopted strategies such as public disclosure of identities and locations of those in isolation to enforce compliance. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSuch measures raised questions surrounding ethical boundaries of disease surveillance. More importantly, the pandemic prompted an in-depth look into existing diagnostic tools and surveillance mechanisms. Five years later, humanity stands at the cusp of a difficult trade-off between safety and privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-key-epidemiological-tool\"\u003eA key epidemiological tool\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy definition, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/medicine-and-dentistry/disease-surveillance\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003edisease surveillance\u003c/a\u003e is \u0026#8220;ongoing, systematic, collection, analysis and interpretation of health data essential to the planning, implementation and evaluation of public health practice, closely integrated with the timely dissemination of these data to those who need to know.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eInfectious disease surveillance is a key epidemiological tool for monitoring diseases, identifying outbreaks, and detecting emerging pathogens. These efforts can rely on traditional forms of surveillance as well as innovative approaches, such as mobile apps and other combination of digital tools. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7563794/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ezoonoses\u003c/a\u003e—diseases transmitted from animals to humans—pose a significant threat to global health, as demonstrated by COVID-19. \u003ca href=\"https://www.emro.who.int/fr/about-who/rc61/zoonotic-diseases.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to the WHO\u003c/a\u003e, there are more than 200 known types of zoonoses. It is estimated that approximately 60% of emerging infectious diseases reported worldwide are zoonoses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome zoonotic diseases, such as rabies, are completely preventable through vaccination. Identifying zoonotic \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/pathogens-use-force-to-bypass-the-immune-system-new-research-says\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003epathogens\u003c/a\u003e in animal populations before they are transmitted to humans enables rapid interventions. Zoonoses know no borders; international cooperation is therefore essential. Nevertheless, differences in surveillance capabilities and data-sharing practices can prevent coordinated responses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-vulnerabilities-of-existing-systems\"\u003eVulnerabilities of existing systems\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite collective acceptance on importance of disease surveillance, the recent pandemic has exposed significant shortcomings. In a \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2213398424003981\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e published in late 2024, scientists assessed the landscape of the 1918 influenza pandemic and the 2019 coronavirus pandemic, mapping potential surveillance sites for the emergence and re-emergence of infectious diseases in Ghana. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe results of the study highlighted the critical importance of strengthening the infectious disease surveillance system. As the researchers pointed out, socioeconomic routes and population density exacerbate the spread of disease, requiring a proactive approach to surveillance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn an interview with \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e, lead study author \u003ca href=\"https://www.researchgate.net/lab/Peter-N-jonaam-Mahama-Lab\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ePeter N-jonaam Mahama\u003c/a\u003e of the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering, School of Engineering, University of Energy and Natural Resources, Ghana, noted that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic has underlined vulnerabilities in existing systems, including mechanisms of delayed detection and response. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eN-jonaam Mahama observed that while significant lessons have been learned from the 1918 influenza and 2019 coronavirus pandemics, it is clear that much more needs to be studied and applied to fully address vulnerabilities in infectious disease surveillance systems, especially in resource-constrained settings. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese pandemics, according to N-jonaam Mahama, pointed to several key shortcomings, such as delayed detection, and inadequate response mechanisms. He said that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic also highlighted several gaps. For example, many countries did not heed early warnings about \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/who-covid-19-pandemic-not-lab-grown\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eCOVID-19\u003c/a\u003e quickly enough.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-modern-technologies\"\u003eModern technologies\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhen asked what modern technologies have the potential to improve zoonotic surveillance, or how innovations can be used to prevent, detect, and control zoonotic outbreaks, N-jonaam Mahama explained that health apps can enable veterinarians to report cases or unusual animal deaths in real-time, while geographic information systems can help in the analysis. \u0026#8220;Innovations in technology, when integrated with the \u003ca href=\"https://www.who.int/health-topics/one-health#tab=tab_1\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eOne Health approach\u003c/a\u003e, can revolutionize zoonotic control,\u0026#8221; added N-jonaam Mahama.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe also noted the importance of satellite imagery and drones that can monitor environmental changes that affect zoonotic risks. For example, the destruction of natural habitats can increase contact between wild animals and humans. That increases the risk of zoonotic transmission. N-jonaam Mahama also highlighted the importance of biosensors that can detect changes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-biosensors-for-disease-surveillance\"\u003eBiosensors for disease surveillance\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors play a crucial role in monitoring infectious diseases. They allow rapid detection of pathogens, which can significantly speed up the response of health authorities to disease outbreaks, especially when it comes to preventing further spread. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780443216589000188\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ewearable biosensors\u003c/a\u003e—like smart bracelets—can monitor vital parameters and notify healthcare workers real time. Although biosensors have enormous potential, their application also carries certain challenges. Namely, they require appropriate data protection measures to ensure user privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135427\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eThe use of pulse oximeters became commonplace during the pandemic Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/a-black-woman-measures-her-oxygen-level-at-home-using-a-pulse-oximeter-gm1453983148-489766379\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003evgajic/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S016599362400462X#sec3\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eIn a 2024 study that focused on biosensors\u003c/a\u003e, it was found that infectious diseases are responsible for almost 15% of deaths in the world. Faster detection enables quicker introduction of preventive measures. That\u0026#8217;s why early detection of pathogens ensures time-efficient medical interventions and more effective disease management. Studies state that the advent of biosensors has enabled the rapid and accurate detection of various pathogens, real-time and on-site.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOne of the corresponding authors of the study is \u003ca href=\"https://kuttam.ku.edu.tr/en/our-staff/academic-staff/faculty-members/mehmet-cengiz-onbasli/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDr Mehmet Cengiz Onbaşlı\u003c/a\u003e from the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at Koç University, Turkey. According to him, COVID-19 has certainly accelerated the development of new biosensors. He pointed to the tens of thousands of new research papers on biosensors every year—about 15,000 to 20,000—and of these, 2,000 to 3,000 are novel or significant enough for potential clinical translation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;When we consider clinical trials, we observe an even smaller fraction of them being translated each year into clinical medical device studies,\u0026#8221; said Cengiz Onbaşlı speaking to \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e. Giving an example, he underscored that a search on \u003ca href=\"https://clinicaltrials.gov/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eClinicalTrials.gov\u003c/a\u003e or other reliable databases revealed only about 10 to 15 clinical trials per year for biomedical devices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-the-role-of-al\"\u003eThe role of Al\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlthough biosensors are important for the detection of pathogens in real-time, artificial intelligence can help in the analysis of huge amounts of data. AI can be used wisely to avoid the kinds of pitfalls that could lead to wrong clinical decisions. “For instance, if you use biosensors with AI for population-scale screening, you would have to make high-specificity and high-sensitivity measurements or classifications to obtain reliable decision points,” said Cengiz Onbaşlı. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGood decisions will therefore require optimized models based on good data. Good data essentially means that it is collected and processed systematically. “We need physicians and seasoned healthcare administrators who will make wise decisions based on common or potential pitfalls of using AI. That\u0026#8217;s why I\u0026#8217;m rather cautious about relying on AI too much, but not integrating it to avoid wrong decisions is also a poor way of thinking,” concluded Cengiz Onbaşlı.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135428\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eRepresentational image of coronavirus mutation. Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/covid-19-new-mutation-variant-pirola-gm1677819202-536411478\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ekoto_feja/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the study co-authored by Cengiz Onbaşlı, while significant progress has been made in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of infectious diseases over the past century, the lack of early detection remains a major obstacle. The lack of early detection of diseases makes it difficult to implement timely interventions, which can generally increase the risk of spread. As per Cengiz Onbaşlı, this is a major concern.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn his opinion, population screening studies require appropriate statistical sampling of communities to ensure early monitoring of disease outbreaks or local epidemics. \u0026#8220;That requires local health authorities to use sensor tools with the appropriate administrative approach, and communities really need to cooperate in conducting population-wide screenings or at least sampling-scale efforts,\u0026#8221; he stated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-privacy-concerns\"\u003ePrivacy concerns\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors are empowering medical professionals to unlock intricacies of the human body, detect diseases in their earliest stages, and move us closer to a future where healthcare is not just a reactive response, but a proactive and personalized endeavor. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn general, when it comes to disease surveillance technologies, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10194177/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ethe issue of privacy\u003c/a\u003e is also pertinent in the interaction between medicine and engineering. As N-jonaam Mahama noted, engineers having access to health data to develop and test applications is important, but privacy concerns and lack of standardized protocols can hinder progress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe use of biosensors involves the collection, transmission, and analysis of sensitive personal health data. Sharing data real-time can expose individuals to challenges such as discrimination based on health status. Hence, it is crucial to ensure that the data is protected and accessible only to authorized persons. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis requires establishing secure data storage facilities to protect against potential breach, as well as implementing strict privacy policies to maintain patient confidentiality. Therefore, there is a need to be transparent in how data is employed, meaning users should be able to control how their data is shared and for what purposes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-question-of-life-and-death\"\u003eA question of life and death\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of disease surveillance in public health. Biosensors and health apps have enormous potential in ensuring early detection. \u003ca href=\"https://www.preventionweb.net/publication/changing-face-pandemic-risk-2024-report\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to an October 2024 report\u003c/a\u003e, 17 outbreaks of dangerous diseases were recorded in 2024 alone. The growing risk of a new pandemic has also put forth concerns over health privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSociety\u0026#8217;s failure to comply with life-saving measures leaves room for more drastic measures, which sometimes includes privacy violations. With viruses being fatal for large swathes of population, the question that rises is if violation of privacy is a small price? The issue is not only a matter of technological progress and science, but literally of life and death. The balance between health and privacy needs to be achieved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"cf:T4a4,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSuch measures raised questions surrounding ethical boundaries of disease surveillance. More importantly, the pandemic prompted an in-depth look into existing diagnostic tools and surveillance mechanisms. Five years later, humanity stands at the cusp of a difficult trade-off between safety and privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-key-epidemiological-tool\"\u003eA key epidemiological tool\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy definition, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/medicine-and-dentistry/disease-surveillance\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003edisease surveillance\u003c/a\u003e is \u0026#8220;ongoing, systematic, collection, analysis and interpretation of health data essential to the planning, implementation and evaluation of public health practice, closely integrated with the timely dissemination of these data to those who need to know.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eInfectious disease surveillance is a key epidemiological tool for monitoring diseases, identifying outbreaks, and detecting emerging pathogens. These efforts can rely on traditional forms of surveillance as well as innovative approaches, such as mobile apps and other combination of digital tools. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d0:T702,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7563794/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ezoonoses\u003c/a\u003e—diseases transmitted from animals to humans—pose a significant threat to global health, as demonstrated by COVID-19. \u003ca href=\"https://www.emro.who.int/fr/about-who/rc61/zoonotic-diseases.html\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to the WHO\u003c/a\u003e, there are more than 200 known types of zoonoses. It is estimated that approximately 60% of emerging infectious diseases reported worldwide are zoonoses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome zoonotic diseases, such as rabies, are completely preventable through vaccination. Identifying zoonotic \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/pathogens-use-force-to-bypass-the-immune-system-new-research-says\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003epathogens\u003c/a\u003e in animal populations before they are transmitted to humans enables rapid interventions. Zoonoses know no borders; international cooperation is therefore essential. Nevertheless, differences in surveillance capabilities and data-sharing practices can prevent coordinated responses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-vulnerabilities-of-existing-systems\"\u003eVulnerabilities of existing systems\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite collective acceptance on importance of disease surveillance, the recent pandemic has exposed significant shortcomings. In a \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2213398424003981\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e published in late 2024, scientists assessed the landscape of the 1918 influenza pandemic and the 2019 coronavirus pandemic, mapping potential surveillance sites for the emergence and re-emergence of infectious diseases in Ghana. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d1:T46c,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe results of the study highlighted the critical importance of strengthening the infectious disease surveillance system. As the researchers pointed out, socioeconomic routes and population density exacerbate the spread of disease, requiring a proactive approach to surveillance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn an interview with \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e, lead study author \u003ca href=\"https://www.researchgate.net/lab/Peter-N-jonaam-Mahama-Lab\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ePeter N-jonaam Mahama\u003c/a\u003e of the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering, School of Engineering, University of Energy and Natural Resources, Ghana, noted that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic has underlined vulnerabilities in existing systems, including mechanisms of delayed detection and response. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eN-jonaam Mahama observed that while significant lessons have been learned from the 1918 influenza and 2019 coronavirus pandemics, it is clear that much more needs to be studied and applied to fully address vulnerabilities in infectious disease surveillance systems, especially in resource-constrained settings. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d2:T60d,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese pandemics, according to N-jonaam Mahama, pointed to several key shortcomings, such as delayed detection, and inadequate response mechanisms. He said that the 2019 coronavirus pandemic also highlighted several gaps. For example, many countries did not heed early warnings about \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/who-covid-19-pandemic-not-lab-grown\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eCOVID-19\u003c/a\u003e quickly enough.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-modern-technologies\"\u003eModern technologies\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhen asked what modern technologies have the potential to improve zoonotic surveillance, or how innovations can be used to prevent, detect, and control zoonotic outbreaks, N-jonaam Mahama explained that health apps can enable veterinarians to report cases or unusual animal deaths in real-time, while geographic information systems can help in the analysis. \u0026#8220;Innovations in technology, when integrated with the \u003ca href=\"https://www.who.int/health-topics/one-health#tab=tab_1\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eOne Health approach\u003c/a\u003e, can revolutionize zoonotic control,\u0026#8221; added N-jonaam Mahama.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe also noted the importance of satellite imagery and drones that can monitor environmental changes that affect zoonotic risks. For example, the destruction of natural habitats can increase contact between wild animals and humans. That increases the risk of zoonotic transmission. N-jonaam Mahama also highlighted the importance of biosensors that can detect changes.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d3:T9ef,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-biosensors-for-disease-surveillance\"\u003eBiosensors for disease surveillance\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors play a crucial role in monitoring infectious diseases. They allow rapid detection of pathogens, which can significantly speed up the response of health authorities to disease outbreaks, especially when it comes to preventing further spread. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780443216589000188\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ewearable biosensors\u003c/a\u003e—like smart bracelets—can monitor vital parameters and notify healthcare workers real time. Although biosensors have enormous potential, their application also carries certain challenges. Namely, they require appropriate data protection measures to ensure user privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135427\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-14539831481.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eThe use of pulse oximeters became commonplace during the pandemic Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/a-black-woman-measures-her-oxygen-level-at-home-using-a-pulse-oximeter-gm1453983148-489766379\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003evgajic/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S016599362400462X#sec3\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eIn a 2024 study that focused on biosensors\u003c/a\u003e, it was found that infectious diseases are responsible for almost 15% of deaths in the world. Faster detection enables quicker introduction of preventive measures. That\u0026#8217;s why early detection of pathogens ensures time-efficient medical interventions and more effective disease management. Studies state that the advent of biosensors has enabled the rapid and accurate detection of various pathogens, real-time and on-site.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d4:T47f,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOne of the corresponding authors of the study is \u003ca href=\"https://kuttam.ku.edu.tr/en/our-staff/academic-staff/faculty-members/mehmet-cengiz-onbasli/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDr Mehmet Cengiz Onbaşlı\u003c/a\u003e from the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at Koç University, Turkey. According to him, COVID-19 has certainly accelerated the development of new biosensors. He pointed to the tens of thousands of new research papers on biosensors every year—about 15,000 to 20,000—and of these, 2,000 to 3,000 are novel or significant enough for potential clinical translation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;When we consider clinical trials, we observe an even smaller fraction of them being translated each year into clinical medical device studies,\u0026#8221; said Cengiz Onbaşlı speaking to \u003cem\u003eInteresting Engineering\u003c/em\u003e. Giving an example, he underscored that a search on \u003ca href=\"https://clinicaltrials.gov/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eClinicalTrials.gov\u003c/a\u003e or other reliable databases revealed only about 10 to 15 clinical trials per year for biomedical devices.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d5:T423,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-the-role-of-al\"\u003eThe role of Al\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlthough biosensors are important for the detection of pathogens in real-time, artificial intelligence can help in the analysis of huge amounts of data. AI can be used wisely to avoid the kinds of pitfalls that could lead to wrong clinical decisions. “For instance, if you use biosensors with AI for population-scale screening, you would have to make high-specificity and high-sensitivity measurements or classifications to obtain reliable decision points,” said Cengiz Onbaşlı. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGood decisions will therefore require optimized models based on good data. Good data essentially means that it is collected and processed systematically. “We need physicians and seasoned healthcare administrators who will make wise decisions based on common or potential pitfalls of using AI. That\u0026#8217;s why I\u0026#8217;m rather cautious about relying on AI too much, but not integrating it to avoid wrong decisions is also a poor way of thinking,” concluded Cengiz Onbaşlı.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d6:T8bd,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-full\"\u003e\u003cimg loading=\"lazy\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1080\" src=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-135428\" srcset=\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg 1920w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/iStock-16778192021.jpg?resize=1536,864 1536w\" sizes=\"auto, (max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003eRepresentational image of coronavirus mutation. Source: \u003ca href=\"https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/covid-19-new-mutation-variant-pirola-gm1677819202-536411478\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ekoto_feja/iStock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the study co-authored by Cengiz Onbaşlı, while significant progress has been made in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of infectious diseases over the past century, the lack of early detection remains a major obstacle. The lack of early detection of diseases makes it difficult to implement timely interventions, which can generally increase the risk of spread. As per Cengiz Onbaşlı, this is a major concern.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn his opinion, population screening studies require appropriate statistical sampling of communities to ensure early monitoring of disease outbreaks or local epidemics. \u0026#8220;That requires local health authorities to use sensor tools with the appropriate administrative approach, and communities really need to cooperate in conducting population-wide screenings or at least sampling-scale efforts,\u0026#8221; he stated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-privacy-concerns\"\u003ePrivacy concerns\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBiosensors are empowering medical professionals to unlock intricacies of the human body, detect diseases in their earliest stages, and move us closer to a future where healthcare is not just a reactive response, but a proactive and personalized endeavor. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d7:T484,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn general, when it comes to disease surveillance technologies, \u003ca href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10194177/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ethe issue of privacy\u003c/a\u003e is also pertinent in the interaction between medicine and engineering. As N-jonaam Mahama noted, engineers having access to health data to develop and test applications is important, but privacy concerns and lack of standardized protocols can hinder progress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe use of biosensors involves the collection, transmission, and analysis of sensitive personal health data. Sharing data real-time can expose individuals to challenges such as discrimination based on health status. Hence, it is crucial to ensure that the data is protected and accessible only to authorized persons. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis requires establishing secure data storage facilities to protect against potential breach, as well as implementing strict privacy policies to maintain patient confidentiality. Therefore, there is a need to be transparent in how data is employed, meaning users should be able to control how their data is shared and for what purposes.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d8:T43d,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-a-question-of-life-and-death\"\u003eA question of life and death\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of disease surveillance in public health. Biosensors and health apps have enormous potential in ensuring early detection. \u003ca href=\"https://www.preventionweb.net/publication/changing-face-pandemic-risk-2024-report\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAccording to an October 2024 report\u003c/a\u003e, 17 outbreaks of dangerous diseases were recorded in 2024 alone. The growing risk of a new pandemic has also put forth concerns over health privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSociety\u0026#8217;s failure to comply with life-saving measures leaves room for more drastic measures, which sometimes includes privacy violations. With viruses being fatal for large swathes of population, the question that rises is if violation of privacy is a small price? The issue is not only a matter of technological progress and science, but literally of life and death. The balance between health and privacy needs to be achieved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"d9:T1cb8,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\u003c!-- This site is optimized with the property=\"og:video\" content=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1FmmBi5bFxE\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:type\" content=\"text/html\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:duration\" content=\"999\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:width\" content=\"480\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:height\" content=\"270\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"ya:ovs:adult\" content=\"false\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"ya:ovs:upload_date\" content=\"2025-01-04T11:35:22+00:00\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"ya:ovs:allow_embed\" content=\"true\" /\u003e\n\u003c!-- / Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"da:T137e,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eIn what could spell bad news for young men suffering from irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), a new study has found a possible connection between the gastrointestinal condition and erectile dysfunction (ED). The study was conducted in a relatively small sample group of 133 Peruvian medical students in their 20s and identified 108% higher chance of ED with students suffering from IBS.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis means that there is a roughly two times the probability of someone suffering from IBS potentially also suffering from ED symptoms—a bit of a double whammy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIBS is a common, chronic gastrointestinal disorder that affects the large intestine. It tends to be characterized by abdominal pain, along with changes in bowel habits such as diarrhea and constipation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/love-hormones-tackle-chronic-gut-pain\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eIBS\u003c/a\u003e is thought to impact around 10% to 15% of all adults in the United States, but only between 5% and 7% have been diagnosed to date. Reasons of IBS range from psychological stress to changes in gut bacteria, but can also be genetic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-erectile-dysfunction-and-ibs\"\u003eErectile dysfunction and IBS\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/microplastics-penises-erectile-dysfunction-concerns\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eErectile dysfunction\u003c/a\u003e is the unfortunate inability of a man to maintain an erection long enough to have sex. While more common in older men, it can affect men of all ages and impacts an estimated 30 million Americans.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2025/01/02/health/young-men-more-likely-to-have-erectile-dysfunction-if-they-also-have-common-condition/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eCauses for ED\u003c/a\u003e are thought to include a wide range of other issues, including cardiovascular problems, hormonal issues, lifestyle, and stress or anxiety. However, this could now include IBS if the study findings are correct. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;We found that medical students diagnosed with IBS exhibited a higher prevalence of ED. The significant relationship between IBS and ED underscores the need to address these issues holistically, considering physical and psychological factors,\u0026#8221; explained the researchers in their paper. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"Erectile Dysfunction: What It Really Is And How To Treat It\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1FmmBi5bFxE?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;This study reveals a significant association between IBS and a higher prevalence of ED in these students,\u0026#8221; the researchers added. As the study suggests, it would appear that stress is likely a significant factor in the expression of IBS and ED in the sample group.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.newsweek.com/erectile-dysfunction-ed-irritable-bowel-syndrome-ibs-health-2009367\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eThe study\u003c/a\u003e also suggests that as IBS tends to alter gut hormones, this could influence blood circulation and nerve function, which are both critical for getting and maintaining an erection.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;This observed association may be because individuals with IBS often experience diminished quality of life resulting from the disease, which commonly results in a significant mental and emotional impact,\u0026#8221; the researchers added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-sample-group-atypical\"\u003eSample group atypical \u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, the choice of sample subjects may have skewed the results somewhat, given the non-typical lifestyle of students compared to the general public. For example, IBS is typically only seen by around 3.8% of people worldwide. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis rate increases to around a third for medical students like those in the study. Of the 133 students analyzed, 10.5% reported they suffered from IBS, while 38.4% had ED, of which 9% had \u0026#8216;severe\u0026#8217; ED.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eStress is known to play havoc with many bodily functions and likely massively influences sex hormone production and other neurological issues. This would express itself in a lower-than-normal sexual appetite, which, coupled with the unpleasant symptoms of IBS, would dramatically impact someone\u0026#8217;s confidence, especially around the opposite sex.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eYou can view the study in the journal \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://academic.oup.com/smoa/article/12/2/qfae021/7663436?login=false#google_vignette\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eSexual Medicine.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"db:T5d1,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIBS is a common, chronic gastrointestinal disorder that affects the large intestine. It tends to be characterized by abdominal pain, along with changes in bowel habits such as diarrhea and constipation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/love-hormones-tackle-chronic-gut-pain\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eIBS\u003c/a\u003e is thought to impact around 10% to 15% of all adults in the United States, but only between 5% and 7% have been diagnosed to date. Reasons of IBS range from psychological stress to changes in gut bacteria, but can also be genetic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-erectile-dysfunction-and-ibs\"\u003eErectile dysfunction and IBS\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/microplastics-penises-erectile-dysfunction-concerns\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eErectile dysfunction\u003c/a\u003e is the unfortunate inability of a man to maintain an erection long enough to have sex. While more common in older men, it can affect men of all ages and impacts an estimated 30 million Americans.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2025/01/02/health/young-men-more-likely-to-have-erectile-dysfunction-if-they-also-have-common-condition/\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eCauses for ED\u003c/a\u003e are thought to include a wide range of other issues, including cardiovascular problems, hormonal issues, lifestyle, and stress or anxiety. However, this could now include IBS if the study findings are correct. \u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"dc:T6f1,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;We found that medical students diagnosed with IBS exhibited a higher prevalence of ED. The significant relationship between IBS and ED underscores the need to address these issues holistically, considering physical and psychological factors,\u0026#8221; explained the researchers in their paper. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"Erectile Dysfunction: What It Really Is And How To Treat It\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1FmmBi5bFxE?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" referrerpolicy=\"strict-origin-when-cross-origin\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;This study reveals a significant association between IBS and a higher prevalence of ED in these students,\u0026#8221; the researchers added. / Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"df:Tffe,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eRecent UAB Department of Genetics and Microbiology research has uncovered a worrying source of micro and nanoplastic (MNPL) pollution released from commonly used food packaging, particularly tea bags. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis study highlights the potential health risks these particles pose, which can penetrate human cells, and calls for immediate regulatory intervention.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003ePlastic pollution has become a pressing environmental issue, with significant consequences for ecosystems and public health. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFood packaging stands out among the myriad of sources contributing to this crisis, as it facilitates exposure to micro and nanoplastics through ingestion and inhalation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-tea-bags-shedding-plastics\"\u003eTea bags shedding plastics\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Mutagenesis Group at UAB spearheaded the investigation, where researchers sought to characterize MNPLs expelled from various commercially available tea bags. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe findings revealed that steeping tea bags in hot \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/spill-the-tea-who-lives-in-your-beverage\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003ewater\u003c/a\u003e resulted in the release of staggering quantities of nano-sized particles, putting consumers at risk for exposure to these harmful pollutants.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe analysis focused on tea bags made from three different materials: nylon-6, polypropylene, and cellulose. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe results were striking: polypropylene released approximately 1.2 billion particles per milliliter, with an average particle size of 136.7 nanometers. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn contrast, cellulose emitted around 135 million particles per milliliter, averaging 244 nanometers in size, while nylon-6 released roughly 8.18 million particles per milliliter, averaging 138.4 nanometers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTo determine the nature of the particles and their potential impact, the research team employed advanced analytical techniques such as scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), infrared spectroscopy (ATR-FTIR), dynamic light scattering (DLS), laser Doppler velocimetry (LDV), and nanoparticle tracking analysis (NTA). \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUAB researcher Alba Garcia emphasized the significance of utilizing these cutting-edge methods to enhance our understanding of MNPLs and their effects on human health.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor the first time, the study also investigated how these released particles interact with human intestinal cells. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe experiments demonstrated that mucus-producing intestinal cells had the highest uptake of micro and nanoplastics, with particles even penetrating the cell nucleus, which houses genetic material. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis finding indicates that intestinal mucus plays a crucial role in absorbing these hazardous contaminants and underscores the urgent need for further research into the long-term health effects of chronic MNPL exposure.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-may-harm-human-cells\"\u003eMay harm human cells\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers stress the importance of developing standardized testing methods to evaluate contamination from plastic food contact materials. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThey advocate for regulatory policies to minimize and mitigate MNPL contamination to safeguard public health. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe increasing use of plastic in food packaging makes \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/teabags-to-measure-wetland-carbon-storage\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eaddressing\u003c/a\u003e these contamination concerns more critical than ever.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the demand for convenience and ready-to-use food products continues to rise, the impact of plastic pollution on human health cannot be ignored. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUnderstanding the implications of micro and nanoplastics, especially as they infiltrate our food supply, is imperative.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs society grapples with the realities of plastic pollution, this study serves as a powerful reminder of the hidden dangers posed by everyday products. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt underlines the need for more rigorous safety protocols to protect public health and the environment.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e0:T50e,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFood packaging stands out among the myriad of sources contributing to this crisis, as it facilitates exposure to micro and nanoplastics through ingestion and inhalation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-tea-bags-shedding-plastics\"\u003eTea bags shedding plastics\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Mutagenesis Group at UAB spearheaded the investigation, where researchers sought to characterize MNPLs expelled from various commercially available tea bags. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe findings revealed that steeping tea bags in hot \u003ca quantities of nano-sized particles, putting consumers at risk for exposure to these harmful pollutants.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe analysis focused on tea bags made from three different materials: nylon-6, polypropylene, and cellulose. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe results were striking: polypropylene released approximately 1.2 billion particles per milliliter, with an average particle size of 136.7 nanometers. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn contrast, cellulose emitted around 135 million particles per milliliter, averaging 244 nanometers in size, while nylon-6 released roughly 8.18 million particles per milliliter, averaging 138.4 nanometers.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e1:T453,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTo determine the nature of the particles and their potential impact, the research team employed advanced analytical techniques such as scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), infrared spectroscopy (ATR-FTIR), dynamic light scattering (DLS), laser Doppler velocimetry (LDV), and nanoparticle tracking analysis (NTA). \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUAB researcher Alba Garcia emphasized the significance of utilizing these cutting-edge methods to enhance our understanding of MNPLs and their effects on human health.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor the first time, the study also investigated how these released particles interact with human intestinal cells. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe experiments demonstrated that mucus-producing intestinal cells had the highest uptake of micro and nanoplastics, with particles even penetrating the cell nucleus, which houses genetic material. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis finding indicates that intestinal mucus plays a crucial role in absorbing these hazardous contaminants and underscores the urgent need for further research into the long-term health effects of chronic MNPL exposure.\u003c/p\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e2:T4a0,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-may-harm-human-cells\"\u003eMay harm human cells\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers stress the importance of developing standardized testing methods to evaluate contamination from plastic food contact materials. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThey advocate for regulatory policies to minimize and mitigate MNPL contamination to safeguard public health. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe increasing use of plastic in food packaging makes \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/science/teabags-to-measure-wetland-carbon-storage\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eaddressing\u003c/a\u003e these contamination concerns more critical than ever.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the demand for convenience and ready-to-use food products continues to rise, the impact of plastic pollution on human health cannot be ignored. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUnderstanding the implications of micro and nanoplastics, especially as they infiltrate our food supply, is imperative.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs society grapples with the realities of plastic pollution, this study serves as a powerful reminder of the hidden dangers posed by everyday products. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt underlines the need for more rigorous safety protocols to protect public health and the / Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e4:T1206,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eResearchers at the University of Queensland are making significant strides toward developing a groundbreaking topical cream to prevent and treat skin cancers, specifically in organ transplant recipients.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis pioneering treatment has secured funding of $344,000 from the National Foundation for Medical Research and Innovation, which will facilitate progress through essential pre-clinical development stages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe cream incorporates a unique drug that has shown promise inhibiting skin cancer formation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis drug was discovered and developed in collaboration with UniQuest\u0026#8217;s small molecule drug discovery initiative, QEDDI.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-world-s-first-skin-cancer-cream\"\u003eWorld’s first skin cancer cream\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAssociate Professor James Wells, affiliated with the university’s Frazer Institute, leads this innovative project.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;This project funding is crucial for advancing the cream through pre-clinical development, enabling us to create a safe and effective formulation for human use,\u0026#8221; said Dr. Wells.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe expressed optimism about the project\u0026#8217;s future, emphasizing, “It’s a significant milestone that we believe will allow us to advance this promising molecule toward clinical trials.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe drug stands out as the only one of its kind, with the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/health/study-melanoma-skin-cancer-risk\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003epotential\u003c/a\u003e not only to prevent the onset of skin cancer but also to treat early-stage conditions in organ transplant patients.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe necessity for such a treatment arises from the reality faced by transplant recipients: to prevent organ rejection, these individuals must take immunosuppressive medications.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile these drugs are life-saving, they also significantly elevate the risk of developing certain skin cancers, notably squamous cell carcinomas (SCC) and Kaposi\u0026#8217;s Sarcoma.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDr. Wells clarified the challenge: “Currently, there are no FDA-approved drugs specifically targeting squamous cell carcinomas in patients who have undergone organ transplants. Instead, managing these skin cancers involves ongoing medical assessments and surgical interventions throughout their lives, until the cancer advances to a point where it metastasizes.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe noted that the current management options leave patients with limited choices that do not compromise the integrity of their transplanted organs. “This new treatment could truly be transformative for these individuals,” he added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-could-replace-surgery\"\u003eCould replace surgery\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe pre-clinical development phase, which QEDDI is spearheading, is critical for assessing the drug’s effectiveness in penetrating the skin and exploring the possibilities for large-scale manufacturing in the future.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis process will ensure that when the cream is ready for human trials, it has undergone rigorous testing to verify its safety and efficacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDr. Dean Moss, the CEO of UniQuest, expressed excitement about the potential impact of this pioneering treatment for organ transplant recipients.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;A first-of-its-kind solution aimed at preventing skin cancer in \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/innovation/worlds-1st-skin-cancer-vaccine-enters-final-trial\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003etransplant\u003c/a\u003e patients represents an extraordinary advancement in medical innovation,\u0026#8221; he stated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDr. Moss highlighted the importance of ongoing support for the project, saying, “It is thrilling to see the project progressing towards clinical applications.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUniQuest has filed patent protections on the new molecule, an important step in safeguarding the intellectual property associated with this innovative treatment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe urgency of developing effective therapies for skin cancer in transplant patients is underscored by statistics indicating that the incidence of skin cancer in these individuals is significantly higher than in the general population.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eContinued advancements like this topical cream are essential for medical innovation and improving the quality of life for thousands of transplant recipients worldwide.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith the promise of moving towards clinical trials, the research team remains hopeful that their work will soon lead to better health outcomes and renewed optimism for individuals at increased risk of skin cancer due to necessary immunosuppressive therapies.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e5:T4ae,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe cream Engineering\",\"url\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/\",\"logo\":{\"@type\":\"ImageObject\",\"inLanguage\":\"en-US\",\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#/schema/logo/image/\",\"url\":\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Interesting_Engineering-1.jpg\",\"contentUrl\":\"https://cms.interestingengineering.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Interesting_Engineering-1.jpg\",\"width\":590,\"height\":198,\"caption\":\"Interesting Engineering\"},\"image\":{\"@id\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/#/schema/logo/image/\"},\"sameAs\":[\"https://www.facebook.com/interestingengineering/\",\"https://x.com/IntEngineering\",\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/interestingengineering/\"],\"email\":\"contact@interestingengineering.com\",\"numberOfEmployees\":{\"@type\":\"QuantitativeValue\",\"minValue\":\"201\",\"maxValue\":\"500\"},\"publishingPrinciples\":\"https://interestingengineering.com/home-page\"}]}\u003c/script\u003e\n\u003c!-- / Yoast SEO Premium plugin. --\u003e"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e8:T12c3,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\u003cp\u003eRecent studies reveal a troubling trend: the number of deaths from antibiotic-resistant bacteria is expected to double by 2050.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCurrently, over 1 million people die each year from these infections, leading researchers to seek new strategies to combat the growing public health crisis.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eA study by scientists at the University of California, San Diego (UCSD) has unveiled a potential weakness in antibiotic-resistant bacteria.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCollaborating with researchers from Arizona State University and Universitat Pompeu Fabra in Spain, Professor Gürol Süel and his team examined the bacterium Bacillus subtilis.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-killing-drug-resistant-bacteria\"\u003eKilling drug-resistant bacteria\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe researchers aimed to understand why mutant variants that develop antibiotic resistance do not outcompete their non-resistant counterparts despite seemingly having an advantage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSurprisingly, they found that antibiotic resistance comes with a significant trade-off.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile such resistance provides survival benefits, it also imposes physiological constraints that hinder the bacteria\u0026#8217;s ability to thrive.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis discovery, published in the journal \u003cem\u003eScience Advances\u003c/em\u003e, could offer new ways to combat antibiotic resistance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eProfessor Süel, part of UCSD’s Department of Molecular Biology, described their finding as an \u0026#8220;Achilles heel\u0026#8221; of antibiotic-resistant bacteria.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe team\u0026#8217;s research suggests that these bacteria can be targeted to prevent the establishment of resistance, ideally without reliance on antibiotics or harmful chemicals.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe study delved into how certain spontaneous genetic mutations allow bacteria to withstand antibiotics.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSüel and his team specifically focused on the \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/innovation/bacteria-aid-recycling-rare-metals\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003erole\u003c/a\u003e of ribosomes—tiny cellular machines crucial for protein synthesis.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAll cells, including bacteria, require charged ions, like magnesium, to function properly. Ribosomes depend on magnesium for stabilization and effectiveness.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDuring their investigation, the researchers discovered that mutant ribosomes that confer antibiotic resistance heavily compete with adenosine triphosphate (ATP)—the energy molecule essential for cellular operations—for limited magnesium ions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis competition results in a \u0026#8220;tug-of-war\u0026#8221; within the bacterial cell, where magnesium scarcity limits antibiotic-resistant strains\u0026#8217; growth more severely than non-resistant strains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-achilles-heel-of-superbugs\"\u003e‘Achilles heel’ of superbugs\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe team identified a ribosomal variant, \u0026#8220;L22,\u0026#8221; in Bacillus subtilis. Their experiments showed that this mutant ribosome\u0026#8217;s struggle for magnesium significantly impaired its growth compared to the wild-type variant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis finding underscores a critical insight: while bacteria develop resistance, their ability to utilize available magnesium is vital for their proliferation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith this knowledge, the researchers propose a novel \u003ca href=\"https://interestingengineering.com/energy/bacteria-make-electricity-from-air-moisture\"  target=\"_blank\"  rel=\"dofollow\"\u003eapproach\u003c/a\u003e to managing antibiotic resistance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy chelating or binding magnesium ions in the bacteria\u0026#8217;s environment, it may be possible to selectively inhibit the growth of resistant strains while leaving beneficial wild-type bacteria unharmed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;A better understanding of the molecular and physiological aspects of antibiotic-resistant bacteria allows us to identify innovative ways to control them without using traditional drugs,\u0026#8221; noted Süel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn a related initiative announced in October, Süel and his team at the University of Chicago introduced a bioelectronic device that harnesses the natural electrical activity of skin bacteria.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis innovation has shown promise in reducing infections caused by Staphylococcus epidermidis, a common bacterium linked to hospital-acquired infections and rising antibiotic resistance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBoth studies emphasize the potential of using charged ions to regulate bacterial behaviors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSüel highlighted the urgency of exploring such drug-free alternatives, stating, \u0026#8220;We are running out of effective antibiotics, and their widespread usage has led to contamination across the globe, including in the oceans and our water supply.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe research indicates that new, sustainable methods to control bacterial infections without relying on antibiotics are feasible and necessary.\u003c/p\u003e\n"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"e9:T410,"])</script><script>self.__next_f.push([1,"\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCollaborating with researchers from Arizona State resistance do not outcompete their non-resistant counterparts despite seemingly having an advantage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSurprisingly, they found that antibiotic resistance comes with a significant trade-off.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile such resistance provides survival benefits, it also imposes physiological constraints that hinder the bacteria\u0026#8217;s ability to thrive.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis discovery, published in the journal \u003cem\u003eScience Advances\u003c/em\u003e, could offer new ways to combat antibiotic property=\"og:video\" content=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/q-hr-Qc4Dz0\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:type\" content=\"text/html\" /\u003e\n\u003cmeta property=\"og:video:duration\"
